text: Not from the Madison area but was recently in town for the Marquette/Madison basketball game (Go Marquette!!!). After a disappointing loss and one too many standard drinks at the bar the night before, I wanted to get back to Milwaukee as quickly as possible the next morning. Much to my chagrin, one of the friends that I stayed with demanded that we get brunch at this fine establishment. I wasn't particularly hungry but ordered the two poached eggs with prosciutto, toast and a Bloody Mary (still trying to drown out the pain of defeat). Absolutely perfect. Food was delicious, portion was just what I was looking for and the plating was adorable!! The Bloody Mary tasted incredibly fresh as well! Needless to say, the meal had awoken my spirits and seemed to say, "hey there, that marquette loss isn't the end of the world, THINGS ARE GOING TO BE OK." Wonderful establishment, pay them a visit as soon as you possibly can.

So I'm obviously very much a latecomer to the Marigold scene, but I do have to comment on a couple of this cute restaurant's offerings.  The red cabbage slaw is maybe the best substitute for a side of chips to go with your sandwich like, really, forever.  It's a tangy vinegar slaw, rather than mayonaissey sweet.  A perfect sprinkling of caraway, and hmm... is that cumin?  Crisp, crunchy, savory & sour.  The open-faced tuna melt was also brilliant.  Bread-&-butter pickles instead of relish -- so simple, yet so good.  But God, I love that slaw!

Great breakfast option! It's not the cheapest place, but the food more than makes up for it. I had the chorizo and corn salsa omelette, which was one of the best I've had. My friends tried other types of omelettes and the breakfast scramble. Everyone loved the food! The atmosphere is nice too, and they had a few spaces to sit outside. The one thing we had to get used to was the ordering and seating. Where we are from you get seated and then you order. We discovered a few restaurants in Madison that have you order first and then sit down. It's a bit confusing when the place is busy because you don't know if there will be a place to sit after you order. However, that is just an observation, and the only thing that really matters to me is the quality of the food. In this case, it is amazing! I could eat that chorizo omelette everyday.

Outstanding little gourmet cafe, just off the Capitol Square, that serves both breakfast and lunch. They make the most amazing French toast out of challah bread; topped with pastry cream, fresh berries, and real maple syrup, it's to die for! For lunch, you can't go wrong with any of their sandwiches, unless you're looking for a salad, in which case the grilled chicken and mixed greens will knock your socks off.
Couldn't think of a better breakfast place. 3 excellent options on the specials chalkboard, great coffee...you won't be disappointed!
Watery coffee. Tea water lukewarm. Food unexceptional. Noisy. Why all the stars again?

Not a good day in the Marigold Kitchen - ordered the Aged Cheddar & Gruyere Grilled Cheese " tomato & Dijon mustard on grilled sourdough that came with a nasty little purple, greasy, tasteless, limp slaw to compliment it, all for $9.00 - - How do you mess up a grilled cheese sandwich???? So disappointed, especially since my firm is a regular customer.

What great food but poor service.  We waited over 22 minutes for our lunch and the waitress told us "hey were busy"....a serious disappointment from a restaurant that used to be rated top notch in my books.

I can't recommend this place enough!! Every person I've brought here has also loved it. It can be a little chaotic but it's worth the wait for a table. Once we're sitting, I barely notice the bustle around us. I get the chili poached eggs almost every time -- absolutely amazing. Their rosemary toast is also to die for!

I am more a fan of this place for their lunch than their breakfast.  The soups are the best I've had in Madison and are always in rotation so you're sure to try a wide variety.  I also love the sandwiches, and the sandwich of the day is also as delicious as any of the regulars.  The side red cabbage salad is decent, but I'd like more tang-usually I skip eating most of it in lieu of a cup of their soup ;)  Breakfast is ok but not out of this world.

The best brunch in Madison? Definitely in the running. This place was incredible - lots of options to accommodate everyone in your party and they make great scrambles. In fact, the only thing keeping them from getting 5 stars from me was their limited selection of vegetarian options - but they easily accommodated me and my scramble without the ham was still phenomenal. Also pleasantly surprising was their French rosemary toast - delicious!! The staff are warm and welcoming, and repeatedly apologized for the 15-minute wait (they shouldn't blame themselves for being so popular!!) -- I left feeling very full and very happy. I'll be a regular here!

Was excited to try this place. it was not great, though. We ordered eggs over medium and they came not even over easy. The white of the egg was not even done. Disgusting. The dish we got prominently featured a large amount of very soggy soggy chips. We also got a short stack of blueberry pancakes. Those were tasty, but they were only about 4 inches across and they only served two. Way too expensive for what we got.

Hard to beat for a quick brunch spot on the weekend, but expect to wait. The line moves fast, but the space is small and its popular.   They have daily (seasonal) specials (pancakes, quiche and scramblers and another random item) and a standing menu of solid options. It's hard to go wrong with anything on the standard menu. My go-to item is the duck hash and my wife is in to the tofu scramble.   We also appreciate that the staff is super friendly and they accommodate food allergies very well.

Fabulous breakfast here on our way up the state! I was rushed in choosing between too many good options thanks to children running amuck, but the meals were delicious, the coffee tasty, and the service very friendly! I'd definitely stop back here if we were to come back through Madison.

So I came in with somewhat high expectations, seeing the good reviews on here and it looked like a really cute place, which it is. I ended up having a pretty bad experience, though, and feel like the ratings do not justify the overall quality.   We got our orders in a timely manner, even though they're packed in the morning because brunch ends at 11:30 or something. Our drinks actually came after our order, which I'm a little put off by, but I loved the hazelnut almond mocha, which was everything I needed for a luxurious pick me up. I ordered the quiche, which was a big mistake. Although restaurant quiche is usually nothing spectacular, this one was not good at all due to a crust that reminded me of a soggy pita bread and a base that did not have enough cream to give it the proper consistency. The microgreen salad it came with was good.   All of that was more or less acceptable, but the most off-putting and distracting part of our experience was the cockroach climbing around the wall.   Anyway, I won't be going back.

As far as brunch goes, I think this is the best restaurant I've been to for it. Nearly everything we have had has been not just good, but excellent. The pancakes are fluffy and have a slightly sweet flavor to them without syrup, the sausage links are great, the frittatas and omelets are very light yet packed with different flavors within. The best aspect, in my opinion, is the blending of flavors in the dishes. Often there is a combination of sweet and savory, or salty and sweet, or spicy and rich. The place is unpretentious (order at the counter, get your own coffee) and friendly. They have a dish for everyone: For the traditional "eggs, bacon, and toast" folks, they have excellent selections, and for the more adventurous eaters they provide unique twists on brunch classics.  Overall, if you moderately enjoy breakfast food and are pondering where to eat in Madison, I'd highly recommend Marigold!

This place is one of the best little secrets tucked away along the capital square. It's definitely geared for those working near the capital that want to get a good lunch...scratch that great lunch.   Their burger, various sandwiches, salads, Moroccan soup are all amazing. For a lunch cafe this place has definitely stepped it's game up, it's fairly traditional lunch food but prepared and presented so much better. From the same guys that operate Sardine just a few blocks away this place elevates work day lunch to the highlight of the day.   I love how fresh the food tastes. All the dishes taste so refreshing. The inside too is great with a huge window, a few outdoor tables, the place just makes you want to smile. It's just so naturally bright inside, a total reprieve from the state buildings and parking lots just outside. All the staff always seems to be in such a good mood too.   I honestly can't say enough about how much I like this place. A lunch can cost you a bit more than standard fare so I always liked to make it a special occasion, but the truest of true treats it is every time.

I have visited twice this month.  Poor food both times:  first visit a hair in food (dish was sent back to kitchen), today cold over easy eggs (yuck) and a quiche that never arrived.  I will not be returning.
Love this for spot for breakfast, but get there early, as so do most other Madisonians.  Lovely GF food options too.

I can understand the draw to this place. I went on a Friday morning and it was steadily busy but not crowded. Order at the counter then they bring your food to you.  The French toast was phenomenal. The berries were sweet, the syrup was on the side - a plus because it was sweet enough on its own.  I really enjoyed the chai latte as well. It had the perfect mix of sweet and spice. I would certainly come back when in Madison.

I love Marigold. It is our go to spot for breakfast when we are in Madison.  Everything we have ordered has been wonderful. Great coffee and cappuccino as well. The only drawback is that it is very small and almost always crowded, but the staff does a great job keeping the food coming and tables moving.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.

One of my favorite spots for breakfast and/or brunch in Madison.  It is worth the trip even if some say it's difficult to find.  I have never been disappointed with my food here and this place doesn't put a hole in your wallet.    I always go on the weekends so there's usually quite a bit of people there but it's worth the wait.  Besides, it's the weekend, and a great atmosphere to spend a lazy morning on a Saturday/Sunday.
Big fan. I go for brunch almost every weekend. The specials are super delicious. If you go before 10:30 it is a little less crowded.

My sister and the locals both recommended this for breakfast. We somehow missed the mid morning surge from the farmers market so only had to wait for 6-8 people to place our order at the front.   Once you order there look to be plenty of seats.  You grab a coffee and water on your own.  Brat and sweet potato hash with coddled (not really poached) eggs was quite good.  The almond butter dominates the nice pancakes-  there is maple syrup.   The chili eggs were fine,  not quite what we expected.  Would return.

1 word...delicious! I came to Madison for the weekend to visit some friends and ate here for brunch on said friends' recommendation. It was a Sunday and the place was PACKED, which I didn't mind because it really added to the atmosphere. I found the staff to be very friendly and with great taste (I ordered based off their suggestions). I highly recommend this place if you ever find yourself in Madison and are looking for a place to have breakfast.

We loved Marigold Kitchen -- our new favorite breakfast place in Madison. Cute, homey little cafe. Order at the counter, sit down, and they bring it to you. The food tastes fresh and homemade. We had driven over from near the University of Wisconsin campus and wondered about street parking. Not to worry; there was a garage nearby.

My favorite place to have breakfast on a Saturday or Sunday Morning. Don't be alarmed if you go in and the seating is all taken. Its a popular Madison breakfast location, but the tables turnover fairly quickly. While you're waiting have a cup of their great coffee and relax. In the summer they also have outdoor seating which is always a advantage in my book.  The restaurant has a diverse population and spirited atmosphere. It is great for morning conversation, or just people watching. The wait staff is incredible and will take great care of you while you are there.  That being said their omelette options are unbeatable. With an array of ingredient options as well as salad a toast included it is a hearty breakfast, but not overwhelming. They also have great granola with fruit if you are looking for something a little lighter.

Fantastic cherry-peach turnover.  Freshly made and Oh. My. God. so good.  Great little place, some tables outside which was lovely in August, when I was last there.  Busy, so we got there early and were lucky enough to get a nice spot outside.  Fantastic breakfast and will definitely be back next time I'm in Madison.

It was crowded when we were there and I believe they could benefit by moving to a bigger space. Otherwise, i got the chicken and bacon sandwich. The pesto was amazing and for that reason alone, 5 stars!

Busy place but definitely worth the wait. We were there on homecoming Saturday but were seated promptly. Blueberry pancakes with orange/almond butter are top 5 for sure. Wife said the hash browns were the best. Would surely go back.

This is one of the best breakfast/lunch spots around the Capitol, and it's off one of the side streets so it's kind of hidden! I had eaten brunch here once before years ago, and went back with some friends for lunch today. The French toast was one of the highly recommended items so we ordered it and it definitely lived up to the expectation! We also got the breakfast sandwich which came on a soft ciabatta roll and was unique with the addition of a cream cheese spread. Our side of breakfast potatoes was really good, the house flavoring gives the potatoes a special flavor. The coffee is very good as well, they are nice about refills. Overall, any sandwich or egg dish seems to be the move- I am more of a savory person, so that may just be personal opinion, but the breads are all fresh and the meats paired excellently with their cheeses and sauce spreads. We went on a rainy day and the environment was comfy and warm, perfect to hangout with friends or study.

A few friends and I went to Marigold over the weekend. We have been there a few times and enjoy the bright atmosphere and delicious brunch. I had the grilled chicken salad for the first time and I am still amazed at how good it was. The omelets are also always great there.  Though the food is a little more pricey than the average breakfast/brunch places in Madison, all of their food is locally produced so you pay a little extra for the quality. Overall I definitely recommend Marigold Kitchen for a great Saturday brunch! My only complaint is that they close at 2:30 which is a little early if you want to grab a late lunch.
Awesome Breakfast it's like you have your own personal chef. Give them a try you won't be sorry.

I loved the friendly, busy atmosphere. The food was amazing both times I went. I liked the fact that they could do a tofu scramble instead of the eggs:) the potatoes are to die for (extra crispy)! A must stop place for coffee & brunch while in Madison!:)

Food - I will give 4 stars. Wait time is horrible for both online ordering and at the restaurant, thus they get 1 star from me. This has happened to me twice. The last time I just left and went to Muramoto.

These guys are great, awesome specials (lunch and breakfast) and the menu is rock solid.  If you go, be sure to pay attention to the seating process, especially on the weekends.  It works, just don't be the guy that screws it up for everyone.    Today my wife and I had the scrambler special and the duck confit.  We also, in a move of gluten, split the banana bread french toast special.  The french toast special was get down good.  Really good banana bread to start and it just got better with every bite.  I also think todays scrambler was one of my favorites.  Sausage, feta, roasted red peppers, spinach.....it was hitting in my wheel house for sure.    They also do great coffee/tea drinks (try the chai, they make it themselves and it is worth it) and lots of good pastry.  My favorite time to visit Marigold is an off our during the week, it doesn't happen often but when I can, that is a great time to go.    Enjoy this place folks, I know I do.

Marigold disappointed us today- we got there before the lunch rush on a Monday and there wasn't even a line.... But we had to wait 45 minutes for our food- which would have been fine if the food was excellent. But the potatoes were cold and horribly burnt, some parts were so charred they were not edible. Previous visits have been worth more like 4 stars, but not today. I don't think we will be back for awhile as it isn't worth paying for parking.
Met some colleagues for a business breakfast here. I had a breakfast skillet and coffee. It was OK, not earth shattering my any means. Maybe I'll try some different for the next time.

I think they can do better than this, based upon their history of positive reviews.  When a popular restaurant is busy, it can be a true test of its excellence, however.  Ordered the poppy seed pancakes at the register per the posted etiquitte, paid, was given a number, grabbed coffee, and took a seat at a recently-vacated table.  Table needed a wiping-down; a torn-off top of a sweetener packet lay next to the condiments.  No sweat - well, not yet, that is.  Young lady busperson, with two neatly-folded towels draped over her forearm, walked adroitly past no fewer than three times, each time observing my table.  Another busperson walked by, noticed I had been waiting for what must have been an unusually extended period, said my assigned number was incorrect and, thus, the reason for the wait.  (Phew, thanks man!)  Breakfast arrives, and I ask the server for a table cleaning.  She eagerly addresses my request and apologizes.  Cool!  Thanks!  Pancakes are well-presented.  They taste great, until I taste someone's sausage - or something.  Cakes are doughy.  But they tasted great, and took care of my sweet tooth for the day.  Upon leaving, I'm bid a "great day" by the lady with towels poised on the forearm.  Perhaps I'm somewhat old-school, but I base my tipping upon the quality of the food served and the service rendered during consumption thereof.  I really think they can do better.

Marigold Kitchen is definitely our favorite breakfast/brunch place in Madison...but unfortunately a lot of other people also choose it as their favorite, because on weekends it is usually a really long wait if you get there for brunch!  This is NOT the place to go with a large party. We never try to go with more than 4 people total, because getting a table will basically be impossible!  The food is great- the seasonal berry french toast is surprisingly light and balanced- and the potato hash is starchy salty heaven!
A lovely breakfast place!  Kind of pricey but I can tell the food is fresh and high quality unlike Mickie s dairy bar,and it's definitely a healthier choice.

I eat here about once a month because it's close to my office and the food is usually good. Friday morning the place was off. The scrambled eggs were dry/overcooked, and the bacon tasted old. The bacon was fatty, limp, and just plain gross. For $13 I got overdone potatoes, overdone eggs, underdone bacon that tasted like it was well over its expiration date, one piece of underdone toast, and some good orange juice. I left over half the meal on the table. The juice was good.

Generally the food here is really good. I typically get an omelet, which comes with home fries. That is more than enough food! The ingredients are fresh and your meal is made quickly. When I'm trying to tap into my inner chubby child, I order a pancake on the side. The blueberry pancakes were very tasty. I recommend going during the week. Weekends are crowded, making seating difficult and your home fries more likely to come out "extra crisp". The wait staff is friendly and the room is open and inviting.
Good for breakfast or brunch, Very conveniently located near the Farmers Market. Great service

I've been here twice and thoroughly enjoyed both experiences. I love restaurants that have you order at the counter because it gives you ample amount of time to study the menu while you wait in line to order/grab a table. I came with a friend at 1pm on a Sunday and there was no wait and ample seating choices. The other time I came was during a more generic brunch time (probably 10:30/11ish?) and even though the line went to the door it moved really quickly and I had barely made up my mind about what I wanted when it was my time to order. I got the cold brew coffee and one of the weekend specials which were mahi mahi fish tacos with cabbage, guacamole, salsa roja, chipotle crema, and 2 eggs and black beans. I was slightly skeptical about getting fish tacos from a brunch place but they were SO good. I think that goes to show the quality of their ingredients and their cooking.  My friend got the mimosa which was made with fresh squeezed oj and the salmon frittata which looked delicious. We also tried their red velvet cupcake and the blueberry compote scone. I'm not a huge fan of scones in general but this one was decent as far as scones go and had a nice thin lemon glaze on top that wasn't overpowering. All in all Marigold is a very solid brunch option and even with a diverse menu they execute it all extremely well.

One of the best breakfast joints I've ever eaten at. Had blueberry pancakes with almond orange butter. Breakfast ciabatta sandwich nicely rounded out the salty portion of the meal.  Must go when you're in Madison.

Yum! Marigold never lets me down. Their sandwiches are fantastic, but I was just as delighted by their brunch when I ordered a chorizo-and-smoked-cheddar omelette last weekend. It can be quite crowded, but turnover is fast enough that I've never had to wait very long for a table. The perfect place to cozy up on a weekend morning, now that we're heading into winter.

Had great meal and good service.  Seating a bit hard to find.  A lot of readers- people spending long time reading God knows what on phone or paper!!.   Hints seats being occupied by people just reading instead of eating.  Overall good food and nice employees.

I went here for breakfast one day, and it was probably the best breakfast of my life. No joke.   I ordered the golden flax cakes (I think). Perfectly cooked with a great peach and butter cream top if I remember correctly. I also got some mini donut holes that were good.  The flavored tea was gross (way to bitter/spicy), but I'm not really a tea guy and have no clue why I ordered it.  Expensive and crowded but worth it if you want some great food.

This was my second visit to Marigold's and was very impressed each time. Get there early for lunch, because it packs up fast as there aren't too many options on the square. I'd recommend 11 or 11:30 at the latest.  I had the chili braised chicken which was amazing. Just the perfect amount of spice. Don't forget to grab a few extra napkins as it was a little messy. Wouldn't recommend for a business meeting :-) However, my co-diners each had different salads and were raving.  Highly recommend!
Outstanding food!  A little hectic for my taste with people everywhere but I really enjoyed the food.  Wow!

Fantastic breakfast but can get so busy it is almost a challenge. Thank god for Super Marigold Woman...she has special powers and busts people for taking up seating before ordering. It is definitely necessary as it gets very busy. French toast on the weekend is deluxe. Espresso is good. The kitchen is a well oiled machine and interesting to watch from the bar. Not a place to pull out the Sunday paper or laptop and chill, Marigold is all about eating and the eating is good.

Marigold just started Sunday brunch a few months ago which is great since they used to only be open for Saturday brunch.   My favorite brunch dish there is the salmon, chive, and cream cheese omelet.  The breakfast egg sandwich is really good too (it has boursin cheese on it).  I've been there for lunch a few times, and have enjoyed their salads as well.  The only thing I've had there that I didn't like was their bloody Mary, it tasted too much like celery for my taste.  It tends to get really busy and crowded on Farmer's Market Saturdays, but I've usually been able to get a table while a friend waited in line to order.  Even when I've had to wait in line to order, the atmosphere and service has always been cheerful.
Food was delicious!!! Loved the omelets and the pancakes! Only negative was the wait due to the small space.

Soooo good! They've got something for everyone and the service is excellent. I asked for a tea latte, which is not on the menu, and the barista literally spent 10 minutes making the most perfect latte ever! The wait can be long on the weekend but it's totally worth it.

We waited to get a table prior to ordering to ensure we would be able to sit to eat, as we had never been here before. After waiting 15 minutes for a table to open up, one did and we sat. We were approached by a waitress that told us we needed to get up from our table and continue to wait because we had not yet ordered. She was unpleasant and would not let us put in our order and keep our table. Our experience was not a good one and we will not be returning.

One of the better cafes I've been to! As soon as you step in the door, you notice the bright, sunny, modern interior, which gives the place a great vibe. I noticed that they also had fresh flowers throughout the cafe, making for a homely and inviting feel. I had the breakfast sandwich, it was so yummy! I think I'll have it again next time I'm back in Madison. Coffee was pretty good: a bit too frothy and not quite as hot as I'd like but this was not a biggie as the food was excellent :)

Didn't see all the hype for this place. First off, finding parking was a pain in the butt. Got to the restaurant and chose the quiche which was listed on the chalkboard to find it wasn't available so there was the next disappointment. Pancakes, scrambler of the day were fine, but portions are small for the price and my teenage kids left hungry.   Staff were very friendly and efficient.
We had duck confit and grilled chicken salad, both average. French toast was awesome. Chai and almond mocha were great. No wifi
Absolutely delicious breakfast. Had the sweet potato hash which was nourishing, healthy and filling. Loved the relaxed coffee shop atmosphere. Highly recommended!

Great food, coffee & a pretty spot to enjoy it in. Not a huge fan of breakfast potatoes but theirs are excellent. The rosemary toast is an out of the ordinary treat. Solid pancakes & egg dishes too!  Coffee is self serve & 5 star yummy.

Very very good! The potatoes are so amazing! They are perfectly cooked with some crunchy and some not! I have most definetly been here more than once. I made sure to bring my mom here while she was visiting for the weekend! And she loved it as well! Great atmosphere for a breakfast place!
Incredibly fresh ingredients, super friendly staff. Had the Marigold Breakfast sandwich and the Barley Sauté, would definitely get again.

First of all, I just want to say I had a crappy morning "a nothing seems to be going right" kind of morning... until I stepped through the doors of Marigold Kitchen. Everyone is so friendly it's hard not to let that rub off on you a little bit. I ordered the French Toast, which is usually my go-to when I go out for breakfast.... but this French Toast blew all the other's out of the water! The almond butter on top is just amazing!!! I am now, a huge fan!

The set up is poor and it's too crowded. Difficult to relax and eat in their loud environment. Staff was incredibly rude to us as they had mistakenly taken our order and brought us one plate of food instead if two  - then they offered to bring us a plate to split it! Ummm how about the other order we paid for? RUDE! Food was good but I WILL NOT go back.

I have been a few times now and always leave happy. The duck confit hash was great. The steel cut oats were great. The tuna melt is the best I've ever had. And one time I had a burger that was delicious.   However, they get a few things wrong. I haven't had everything on the menu so I can't speak to everything but I have had a few things I didn't like. Their soups, for instance, don't always come out tasting as great as they sound. I have had one that was incredibly salty, and another that was just bland. Also, all of their sandwiches come with a red cabbage salad which should be delicious. But, instead it comes out tasting like a sour mess filled with what I think are fennel seeds, maybe anise. And to upgrade to a classy green salad smothered with balsamic costs another 1.50...who the hell upcharges for greens?  All in all their food is great and I feel safe ordering anything on the menu, except for soups. Also, next time I will just ask for nothing on the side as the mound of red cabbage always tempts...but also always disappoints.

Oh god.  Ok, first of all I LIVE for a good brunch.  I don't mind lines, not one bit (and I've seen some fucking brunch lines in my day), but when I have to order at the counter and THEN table-wait with my silverware, coffee and order number in hand, we have a problem.  I need the whole experience to occur while seated.  Call me crazy.  I like to sit with my menu and my coffee while I decide, not be shanghied into ordering the second I walk in the door.    It's not like you're getting your food any sooner after being seated either.  It still takes a while.    My brioche french toast was cold and not even slightly flavorful.  There was a weird taste to it, like they tried to infuse it with orange but ended up stirring rancid oj into the egg batter.  Just gross.  Had I not been starving it would've been sent back.  The duck confit hash was delicious, but, seriously, how can you screw up anything fried in duck fat?    Oh, AND they ran out of coffee.  For like at least a half hour there was no coffee in the joint.  Come ON, dudes, you're lucky to get even the second star here.

Not busy on a Thursday.  Coffee okay, not great.  Friendly staff.  Had the "Scrambler", which had bacon,cheese, tomatoes, spinach in it.  Very nice.  Served with a side of roasted potatoes that were almost burnt.  A little too crispy and salty for me.

You will walk into this place then want to walk back out. The line's usually out the door, and even once you get around to ordering, there might not be any seating. This is a good sign, people love the place. The only problem I have with the food is when crowded customers bump me and I loose some of it. The rosemary potatoes go great with everything.

Love coming here for brunch! The omelettes and pancakes here are of such high quality.. we lived in SF and Boston prior to moving to Madison and this is on par with brunches we've had there. Our toddler gets up early which suits us well so we can get to Marigold Kitchen before the crowds arrive!

I have been to Marigold's several times. This is partly because it was close to my old place. I only go there for brunch. The place is really cute and cozy. Sometimes it's CRAZY busy so be prepared to wait.   They have super good pancakes. This is mostly because the syrup is so good! Also their roasted potatoes are so yum! The breakfast sandwich is VERY good too.  Also I love that they always have great pastries. Say yes to the muffins!  If you're in Madison, WI this is a nice place to have brunch.
Great brunch place, but very popular, so be prepared to wait for a table.  My spinach and goat cheese scramble was delicious.
Great food. It's a little crazy with how crowded it is, but their food is on spot.
Very good breakfasts. The bacon is high quality. Potatoes are delish. Good ambience and very friendly service.

Très bons petits déjeuners. Le service est très agréable, le choix pas forcement très large mais avec des choses plutôt travaillées, rafinées et originales. Plus orienté chic que diner. Un contraste sympa et complémentaire avec Mickies Dairy bar, carrément orienté diner. La clientèle est plus branché, cadre, enseignants, fonctionnaires qu'étudiants et travailleurs. Très bonne adresse

This place always reminded me of New York for some reason. Now that I'm in NYC, I can't quite find anywhere quite like it!  I come here on the weekends strictly for the duck confit hash. It is so fresh and delicious and fills you up in a very healthy way. There's even enough to take home for a late lunch later in the day.  Come early in order to score a seat!
This place is awesome! Local, organic ingredients with a creative menu and quick and friendly service.

Sunday brunch at Marigold has become a tradition for us. While I hate crowds and it is usually very crowded, somehow the unique flow of waiting in line to order and then hoping there's a table available had always worked out for us. Just be patient! I always get either the breakfast sandwich with some kind of delicious cheese spread or the weekly pancake special that always includes a delicious flavored butter. Another favorite is the maple latte. The potatoes are obviously a must have.

I had the duck confit hash with poached eggs which was delicious $12. Mom had the pancakes, she said they had an orange taste to them, she loved them. The guys running the grill are super efficient, we waited for 15min for food tops...super fast for being there on a Sunday afternoon. The ambiance is hipster. I saw a few kids in there, not too many older people

At first I was upset at their seating system even though I was doing a carrying out. They allowed one person to take a table for ten(which had to be made from 4 smaller tables) when none of the remainder of the party was present or even in line. This caused a huge back up for people waiting for a table in a tiny place and waiting for food. Then I received our order and it was a the most salted food I have ever have been served. The eggs and the potatoes tasted more like a salt shaker than food. Very disappointing place.

While the food at Marigolds is delicious, the service completely ruins the experience. They have a poor system of ordering at the counter and having food brought out, and when they do make a mistake, they don't admit it. They let you sit there for an hour waiting for food that won't ever come, and make you ask three times for your money back. Don't go here, the manager is an absolute idiot. What matters more, an accounting error that THEY made or maintaining halfway decent customer service?

The service was incredibly friendly. I wanted the ham and gruyere omelette but I can't have nitrates so I asked the lady at the counter and she wasn't sure so she went out of her way to find out.  The food was equally impressive. The eggs were perfectly cooked - not too dry/wet and the pancakes were fluffy and light. Best breakfast in town.
I once drove from Detroit just to have brunch here.  Okay, it was also to visit my family, but their breakfast & brunch menus are wonderful.

Marigold was my favorite spot for lunch in Madison for more than a year, and I miss it, especially the salads.   This is definitely not a secret spot - it's packed because it's so good!  Sometimes there's not even a chair to sit in while you wait for your take-out order.  On a cold day, order soup. On a nice day, eat outside!
Everything is great!   Maple latte, yumm!  Steel cut oats with strawberries, breakfast scramble, ceasar salad!   And so close to the hilton!

Went here this morning , on a whim !! Well it did not disappoint; I had the 3 grain breakfast, I sometimes get ' healthy ' things for brekkie and am usually unsatisfied and still hungry , it's now 10 hours later and I'm still thinking of the delicious flavors And colors ! My daughter is a picky eater and they couldn't have been more accommodating.  We also had the cinnamon muffins for dessert, another win !   This definitely is a fantastic place , Madison is a super cute town And this is a perfect compliment to the city !!

Met a friend for brunch there this morning; we were a little on the early side for a Saturday morning, arriving about 9:30.  By the time we left, the place was full and there was a wait at the counter.    I had coffee and the biscuits/gravy with eggs and field greens for $10.95, my friend ordered the breakfast sandwich for $5.95.  Frankly, my meal was overpriced, and wasn't of sufficiently higher quality to justify the additional charge over, say, Denny's.  I'm not opposed to paying for atmosphere or creative and fresh cooking; this just wasn't special enough, IMO.  My friend's sandwich, on the other hand, was tremendous- on ciabatta with eggs, tomato, applewood bacon, etc.  I'd definitely order that again.  It's great that they serve Ancora coffee- a definite plus in my book.  It's family-friendly, but the kids there were generally well-behaved- also another plus.  Didn't feel rushed and the decor is comfortable.

Went there this morning for breakfast, at first everything was good, got our order in quickly despite it being busy and got our coffee quick too, the maple latte is really good. But then we waited 50 minutes for our food, which was descent but not worth the wait. Two other tables around us also got part of their orders wrong and things sent back to the kitchen. Kitchen was disorganized and even at a nice restaurant you don't wait that long, no one even apologized for the wait. Overall not worth the wait.

Fun environment with excellent food. We stopped in for breakfast after staying overnight at the Edgewater Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful as we browsed the menu and prepared to order. I thoroughly enjoyed my french toast with berries and latte. As others have said, I'd recommend getting in early as they do fill up very quickly. I look forward to visiting again when we're in Madison!
I love this place. The food is really seasonal and always high quality. Wish they were open for dinner!
My favorite place.  Fresh, real and scrumptious. You've gotta try the duck confit hash salad (WOAH!!), freshly squeezed juices, and pastries.  You really can't go wrong here.  It's the BEST!

Have visited Madison 5 times and never been to Marigold.  What a SHAME!   This is my favorite of maybe 15 places over the last 4 years of visting.  Delicious food!  Fast, friendly service!  Nice ambience!  Excellent all around!
On this warm sunny day in Madison we stopped by and enjoyed outdoor seating with a large delicious piece of quiche and a wonderful pot of tea. Highly recommended.

i looooooove this place, especially for breakfast/brunch. the breakfast sandwich is delicious, the lunch menu always has a good mix of filling sandwiches & salads... order + pay at the counter, pick a seat, eat, leave a tip for servers delivering food and checking on ya, walk out happy.

Possibly the best chilaquiles I have ever had in my entire life.  I am a big fan of chilaquiles and these are definitely the best in town I've had.  If you know a better spot for chilaquiles please let me know so I can enjoy them there too!  Also, they pump this food out at incredibly fast speeds.  We ordered directly behind a few other parties and got our food within 5 minutes.

The most delicious blueberry pancakes I've ever had followed by several awesome mimosas.  I'm not positive that they serve mimosas and the other alcoholic drinks for every breakfast, I went on a saturday which happens to be the only day then mention such drinks on their website.  Also the staff was very friendly and the restaurant was super clean.

One of my close friends took a trip out to Madison, and raved about Marigold Kitchen upon her return. I made a mental note to check it out if I was ever in the area, and the day happened a lot sooner than I expected. Unfortunately, my experience wasn't nearly as exciting as I had hoped it would.  This may have something to do with my vegetarianism. There is a limited number of savory vegetarian breakfast items on the menu, but it's never too hard for me to find something I want to eat. I opted to get an omlette, which tasted fine. But, that was the problem for me-- it was fine, but it was also surprisingly boring. The omlette was good, but I've had countless omlettes that tasted better.  The potatoes were delicious, until my oversalted second bite. The most exciting part of my meal was the rosemary toast not necessarily because it was the most delicious part, but because it was the most unique.  For all the hype, I had expected some pretty spectacular food; instead, I found pretty good food.  Marigold Kitchen does have a great environment though-- fast and service, cozy decor, friendly atmosphere, all lending to a good, if not memorable, experience.

Went here for Sunday brunch and all I can say is, YUM! My little nephew likes it so well that he went back two days in a row and got the same thing- French toast. You order at the counter and they have a lot to choose from! I got a zucchini omelette that came with greens and potatoes and toast. I will say that I would have wished for more toast and fewer potatoes, but I also supplemented that with a fruit plate so it was all good. The carrot cake looked amazing but I didn't want to get back in line. There is a little pressure to finish quickly to turn over the table, but the ingredients are natural and delicious and it's such a cute place that that kind of negates any small drawbacks.

Like almost everyone else, I came here for breakfast and absolutely loved it. Everything is reasonably priced, which is great considering cafés downtown tend to jack up their food prices. Everyone working there was really friendly and the food came up quickly.  The coffee was also pretty darn good, and I loved that it was self serve (when I was there at least). As for the food, I only got a basic one egg meal but the potatoes and rosemary toast are worth going there by themselves.  I'd say the only downside is the high ceilings, which look really cool but cause the place to get fairly noisy when a lot of people are around.

This has become our staple brunch spot. I highly recommend the breakfast sandwich. The macaroons are ok, just a little dry. My boyfriend always orders the french toast and the almond hazelnut mocha, it is his favorite brunch combo now...and that is coming from a self-proclaimed french toast connoisseur! Tip, if there is a line have a friend run up to the front register to grab menus for you. That way you're ready to order when you reach the counter.

Fabulous place for breakfast.   My husband had the Mahi Mahi tacos and I had the french toast.  Both were delicious.   We split a blackberry cherry scone.  It was good but the entrees were the best.  Great coffee too.
Great breakfast place. Go for the pancakes! Be prepared to wait if you show up after 10 am.

Casual and delicious! Seriously, everything is fresh and yummy.  Staff was friendly and menu items were creative.  You can't go wrong if your looking for something a little different at a reasonable price.

Been a customer for 6yrs now. My family's go to spot for breakfast. My wife fell in love with the duck confit hash the first time she was there and orders it time and again. I wander about the menu a bit and jump at the occasional special and always satisfied with my decision. Taken lots of family visiting from out of state and the consensus is that its really good. Best of all, one time I took my 4yr old there for his birthday and when the waiter found out we were celebrating he asked everyone in the building to help him sing happy bday to my son. To have the entire place join in song, patrons included, was amazing. This place is about a lot more than just food.

The hardest part is deciding what to eat and, so far, I've discovered that you can't go wrong.  I've been several times for lunch and brunch. Ordering off the printed menu is always solid and so are the daily specials. Chili braised chicken sandwich is my lunch pick and the chorizo corn omelet is my breakfast go-to. The salads are also great and super satisfying.   One word of warning: there's bound to be a loooong wait at peak times, so try to beat the crowd.
This place is very different from other places I've been to! It's pretty neat! The food was great! Can't really say much about service

I've always ordered the breakfast sandwich, which is delicious. Today someone I was with ordered the chilaquiles and oh my god. They were amazing. I stole many bites when she wasn't looking. Get them with chorizo and avocado. So good.   I still don't like their breakfast potatoes though. Wayyyyyy toooooo greasy for me. Soaked.

Marigold is by far the best place for breakfast/brunch in Madison.  Every dish I've tried, from the house-made granola to the steel-cut oats, from the varying egg scrambler (changes daily) or duck hash (duck! HASH!) to the pancakes and waffles, this restaurant will give you that food coma you so deserve.    More pluses: -Fresh squeezed orange juice -A large selection of baked tarts, scones, and muffins -Easy ordering (line up and order at the counter; then grab a number and find a table.  This can be a bit daunting during crowded times, but I have never had a problem getting a seat by the time my food was ready, and the servers help you out with this if needed). -COFFEE.  VERY GOOD COFFEE.  They hand you the mugs right away so you can fill 'er up yourself while you wait for your table. -Counter seating. -"Too much" (meaning just enough) food on the plate...enough for a doggie bag. -They have some brunchy cocktails, including one called a greyhound (grapefruit juice & vodka) along with the usual standards (mimosa, screwdriver, bloody mary). -The sourdough toast: NOM NOM.  Minuses: -Can be a bit cramped; it's a small space and everyone and their mother (and their many kids) loves to eat here. -Closed on Sundays!  Boooo!

I've gotta say, when I walked in I was a little leery.  The line went to the door and the place was packed.  I anticipated either having to wait a long time for a table or have our food, which is ordered at the counter, arrive before we had a table.  I must say I was quite impressed with how fast they turned tables.  It took very little time at all to work our way through the line and have a table ready for us.    Because of the efficiency and speed at which they turn tables, brunch felt very rushed and that is the only thing that detracted from the food, which by the way was fantastic.    This is the best brunch I've had by far in Madison thus far and a place I really need to go back to now that I know what to expect.

This is one of my favorite places for brunch in Madison!   I had the guajillo chicken tostada today and it was probably one of my least favorite dishes I've had at Marigold because of the fact it's so lackluster next to the other dishes I've had here, not to say that it was bad, but it was particularly average.  Time after time, the duck confit hash and the pancakes keep me coming back, so I might stick to those next time. There are fun omelette combinations and those are always yummy too!  If you come on the weekend, be prepared to wait a little bit for a seat. It's a somewhat pricey for what you're getting, but you're paying for location too I guess. After a lovely brunch, you'll leave smelling very strongly of breakfast food (in the best way).

I loved this place.  Our son, Andrew, and girlfriend, Sara, took us here to enjoy a wonderful breakfast on our recent trip to Wisconsin.... Everything they had here was delicious and I hope to get a chance to go back some day.  It was definitely worth the wait to get in.  I had the strawberry pancakes with marscapone cheese and I will dream about it now.

This place was my last pit stop in WI... and it was GREAT!  It's not listed on the menu and they don't really announce it, but the restaurant is buy local! I LOVE IT! I only know that because of the board by the Restrooms.  Very similar to Kansas City's "You say Tomato" restaurant. You check out the menu, and head to the counter to order get a number and they will bring you the food.   Madison, WELL DONE! This is differently a breakfast stop that I will be coming to a lot. Especially now that I might be heading that way very often =D.   It's kinda of in an odd area. Well I think it is just because the streets in Madison are freaking WEIRD! lol, but none the least. If youre a UW student, it's super close to campus... So find a random place to park around the capital, and just walk there!   Pricing isn't bad at all! Actually I thought it was pretty cheap! And a great size for what you pay for. I got the Salmon Frittata, for only 11 bucks. what!!!! Couple of my friends got theirs for $15 but there were huge!  Would I go back? YASS! it's a bit small inside... but they have seating outside

This place is a gem. If you like a laid back ambiance, great food and don't mind a wait, you'll be happy here. As you enter, you go straight to the registers (or to the back of the long line!!) and order there. They have menus by the registers, as well as specials written on the chalk boards, so you can be prepared to order by the time you reach the front. Once you've placed your order they'll give you a number and you can find your seat. Breakfast and lunch are both delicious, I think you're safe with any food choice here! It's all very fresh and well prepared/plated. The thing that impressed me most with Marigold on my most recent visit was the service. My mom and I arrived for a late lunch a few minutes before 2 pm. We were not rushed, took our time ordering, and enjoyed a leisurely lunch outside. As we were finishing up, I wondered aloud what time they closed, as it dawned on me that it was pretty quiet. They close at 2!!! OOPS! I feel terrible that we came and ordered soo close to closing and then took our sweet time. We would have never done that had we known. But this is why I left feeling so impressed with their service. The young man working the register was perfectly polite and did not say or do anything to make me believe he didn't want us there. He took my order "for here" as though nothing were strange about it at all. The woman who brought our food was also very polite and we were never made to feel rushed or as though we were unwanted in their space during our meal. I would like to offer my apologies to the staff for staying so far passed close... but also praise them up and down for wonderful service!

Great place for breakfast.  Pastries are delicious. Everything they make here is good. For the people who don't know the rule about grabbing a table before ordering, shame on you. Staff are super friendly, but the credit should go to the people behind the scenes, they do an excellent job day in and day out. And rarely are recognized for their efforts.  Kudos to you guys especially.

Whenever I have conference in Wisconsin, I always make sure I reserve time to have breakfast at Marigold Kitchen. I particularly love their French toasts with almond sauce and berries on them. They are tasty enough without adding maple syrup. Chocolate almond latte and lavender latte are a must-try, though I find them a bit too sweet but the flavor is amazing. Their breakfast is always something I look forward to when I have conference in Madison.

We were just in Madison for a few days, and looked up restaurants on yelp to make sure we're eat nothing but great food. The breakfast here sounded fantastic, and we were disappointed when we realized, as we arrived, that they had just stopped serving breakfast and our choices now were mostly all-American sandwiches.  Lacking other breakfast options, we took our sad faces to the counter to order some sandwiches and coffee and were soon pleasantly surprised: That burger I ordered with no particular expectations might have just been the best burger of my entire life. So, so good. My partner said the same about the tilapia sandwich. I can't wait to come back here and try everything else (maybe even make it in time for breakfast).

Great spot downtown for breakfast or lunch. We were visiting from California, in search of the best Bloody Mary in Madison, and Marigold was the winner (despite not being served with the standard Wisconsin sidecar). Duck confit hash was incredible, as was the brioche French toast. Friendly service in an understated coffee shop atmosphere. We will definitely be back!

I absolutely loved their buttermilk pancakes, especially topped with almond orange butter. The combination of almond orange butter, powdered sugar, and maple syrup is just fantastic. I'd definitely order them again.  The staff serves your breakfast directly to the table and even sets out your silverware for you--no unwrapping a napkin to get at your knife and fork. Friendly service, delicious food. It recommends itself.

First time in Madison and this place was recommended to stop for breakfast from a close friend....and we are so happy we did!  Fun atmosphere and good people all around. We got here around 9a on a Saturday, not much of a line (but there was by 9:45am when we left!). The service was fast and friendly and you never felt rushed....and the food was delicious. We ordered the nitro brews which tasted like a coffee milkshake, ham and gruyere omelet and the scrambled weekend special. The rosemary toast paired REALLY well with the omelet!!  We would come back for sure.

Whatever you get, it's going to be delicious!  Initially entering, the set up of the restaurant is a little confusing. You wait in line at the door, order your food and beverage at the counter, are given a number, proceed to the wall, and wait to be seated. This entire process took about 20 minutes(only 5 or so from actually placing our order.) We went on a Sunday morning, so it was fairly busy. Staff was friendly and quick moving to help get people in and out. The decor is cozy; a little Tuscan, bohemian kitchen type feel. A server brought our drinks to the table, followed shortly after by the food. THE FOOD! You guys, if you're not won over by the amazing smell or visual presentation, you certainly will be by the tastes! Light, fluffy, flavorful French toast, hearty and semi healthy pancakes, both served with warm syrup, and a soothing mocha or energizing cup of coffee. Just what you need to fuel you for a downtown stroll by the capital afterward. Can't go wrong! Hope you enjoy your visit!

Had lunch here and it was excellent. I got a grilled vegetable sandwich which was huge and tasty on grilled wheat bread, and my wife had a tuna sandwich on grilled sourdough. I also started with the gazpacho which was quite tasty. The interior "ambiance" is nonexistent. It's loud and you order at the counter and someone brings you your food after spotting your number. But no matter, the food more than made the experience and I'll definitely go back there next time I'm in Madison.
Amazing eggs and potatoes. Perfect pastries. The apple french toast woke us up in such a sweet and refined way. Great service. Not posh, and very busy - but nevertheless perfect.

Probably one of the best breakfast/lunch places in Madison if you're looking for fresh food with lots of flavor. They have specials daily - usually a type of breakfast entree, a soup and a sandwich type. Breakfast can always be ordered. Their duck confit hash is probably my favorite breakfast item and I love their Guajillo Braised Chicken sandwich for lunch.

Really great meal and ambiance.  The "Marigold Potatoes" were my favorite. I almost didnt eat them because of their appearance but am so glad I did....i could have licked my plate! The rosemary toast was also great.  Cappucino and omelette were average and i did feel it was a tiny bit expensive and that there were a couple other flaws (no spoon with my coffee and decorative flowers fairly wilted) but overall great experience.

Greeted by nice people this order and sit place has a warm and inviting atmosphere.   The duck confit hash is both subtle and tasty, something that is hard to do with duck and harder with hash.   The pancakes are light and perfect. This is way better than its 4 stars suggests.
Went for lunch. Had the turkey and pear sandwich. Flavor combination was very good. Also had a macaroon...yummy!!   Small but comfortable place.

I've brunched/lunched at Marigold Kitchen while traveling to Madison for business many times and it never disappoints!   It's a very causal, order-at-the-counter, fill-up-your-own-water, kind of place. They have many unique breakfast and lunch options as well as daily specials that always leave me torn on what to order.  My all time favorite meal at MK is the roasted sweet potato, kale and basil walnut pesto hash. But you really can't go wrong with anything else!  Be sure to check this place out if you find yourself in Madison. They have outdoor seating too!

I came here to have my last lunch in Madison.   Needless to say, everything I had was fresh and a great combination of flavors.   I'm so sad that I discovered it so late. Makes my tummy sad, but probably good for my waistline.

Fantastic place for brunch. I went to Marigold with a few of friends for Sunday brunch and it was a good experience! The line was out the door when we got there, but didn't take too long to get to the front and order... it is set up where you order at the counter, the waiter ushers you to a table to sit down and the brings the orders to the table from the kitchen.   I ordered a cup of coffee (Colectivo coffee, bottomless) and the scrambler with sourdough bread. It was SO MUCH FOOD but so good. There was a bit more cheese on the scrambler than I would have liked, but nothing I couldn't scrape off. All of my friends said they enjoyed their dishes, however one who had ordered the chilaquiles had asked for the beans on the side and they ended up being served within her main plate rather than on a separate dish.   The place is pretty small, so if it is busy, it feels like you cannot stay too long so that others can sit. But, the food is amazing and the atmosphere is really fun for a small brunch get together -- definitely worth a visit!

Never disappointed when we come here for brunch.  Typically a line when you come in.  Don't let that scare you.  Just jump in line and be patient.  By the time you order your food there will be a table open and ready for you.  Food comes quickly and is always fantastic.  Super friendly staff too.  Perfect place to head to after the farmers market.

I don't see what the big deal is about this place. I've had brunch there a few times and it was good but not 5 Stars good. The location is great for people that live downtown because there are not a lot of brunch options. The staff is friendly, but it's Madison so the staff is friendly at most places. The prices are good and reasonable. The food is good too, but it's not amazingly good. My girlfriend is crazy about the hash browns. I find them way too greasy. They leave this orangish colored grease streak on your plate that I was never a fan of. Overall, it's a good spot for brunch, but if you are expecting to be blown away, don't.  I would take Mickey's Dairy Bar over Marigold any day of the week...accept Monday because that day Mickey's is closed!
This place is absolutely healthy and awesome. I've never had greens with a omlete, and it was so good!
The ham and spinach quiche was amazing. The coffee was good. The employees were very helpful and friendly.  I would return to try the other items.
The best grilled cheese I have ever had! (Goat cheese & WI cheddar w/tomato & grilled to perfection!)

I've never been here for breakfast, so I can't speak to the many negative comments about that. However, their lunch is fantastic! I've eaten there several times, and I've never been disappointed. My last meal there was basically a salade nicoise but with salmon rather than tuna. The haricots verts were snappy, the dressing was excellent, and the fish was perfectly cooked. Yes, the space is a little cramped, but this doesn't matter since the service is fast. If it's too crowded for you you can get in and get out quickly.

Cheerful colors are splashed across the walls and sunshine spills in through the floor-length front windows.  Brightly colored fresh flowers are in delicate vases on every table, offering even more charm to the Marigold Kitchen.    There was no wait at 1pm on this chilly Sunday.  Orders were placed and paid for at the counter and servers promptly delivered the food, tracking you down via a number set on your table.  The brunch menu offered lots of good breakfast options, plenty of which were veg-friendly.  I opted for the inexpensive (at $4.75) and generously portioned eggs/potatoes/toast combo.  The potatoes were a little oily, but nicely seasoned and seemed to have a slight sprinkling of cheese which was a nice touch.   There were only a few lunch options on the brunch menu (none of which were vegetarian), I wished that more of the weekday lunch menu selections were available at weekend brunch-time.  BOTTOM LINE:  Loved the bright and cheerful atmosphere; brunch was great.  A few more lunch choices on the brunch menu (especially a vegetarian choice or two) would make it fantastico!

Living just two blocks away from this weekend brunch mecca, and having bought a $125 gift card for $100 on my first visit, I really wanted to like this place.   I really, really wanted to.  Food:  Pancakes (Buckwheat, Peach, Buttermilk, etc.): $7-$10 -While they tout using only the freshest and finest ingredients, they don't seem to use enough of them.  The pancakes overall are somewhat bland, and everything tastes similar.  In the end, you're really just eating a maple syrup conveyor.  Duck Confit Hash: $9.95 Judge an ice-cream shop by its vanilla, sure.  But if you put the poultry Inception that is duck confit on the menu, I'm going to try it. -The duck confit was remarkably dry for something that had supposedly been rendered in its own fat, and definitely was not worth even the ten bucks they were asking. -While I was hoping it was made into a hash in order to stretch a small quantity of great duck into a larger serving, it seems that the hash was more a method to hide the fact that you were just being served bits of salty duck.   Ambiance:  The real reason I rated this place so low is because of the overall dining environment.  It would be two stars, were it not for the fact that I know I'm going during their busiest times.  If you come here during the weekend, it will be packed. Chances are, nobody will greet you or explain anything to you, but that's fine as you will have stood in a line by the time you entered the first door.  This line leads directly to the cash register, but does wrap around a pillar that holds the menus, so you can figure out what you want while you watch other people eat. If you decide to grab a seat before ordering (seems reasonable, right?), you will be informed (loudly enough for everyone else in line to get the memo) that guests should please refrain from trying to get seats prior to ordering.  Alright, message received, the cluster' will begin after you pay. You'll order, sit down at the waiting area that is pleasantly placed right next to the restrooms, holding your number tag like a branded cow, and desperately look for the next group to leave (It's best to have any females in the party have a scarf or purse handy to drop on the seat to claim territory, as -from experience- other parties will be doing the exact same thing).  The aforementioned just-okay food will arrive, and you can finally eat.  They bring you your coffee as well, and you can finish your meal in relative peace.  --That is--, unless you arrived at a time that they were so busy, that there was still a line as you were finishing your meal.  In that case, their staff is apparently trained to actually ask you to either finish up your conversation and leave, or migrate to a smaller table so that they can seat another party. Keep in mind, this is about two minutes after you pay your check, and are just trying to drink down the last bit of coffee.  By no means do you need to make any effort to delay your own exit for this wonderful display of hospitality to occur.  What in the absolute hell kind of place, one block away from the Capitol, doesn't have any consistent or fair seating logistic when the line goes out the door, and asks their own patrons to either leave or change tables when they are literally 95% of the way through their meal?   In summary, this location has honestly been a terrible way to start my weekends 3 times out of 4, may be better during weekdays but I do not have the schedule for that, and is really only worth going to if you want to see or be seen by rich housewives taking their preppy children out to brunch.

I've been going to Marigold Kitchen for many years and it is one of my favorite places for breakfast in Madison. The lines can be long on the weekends, but the food is worth the wait. I would highly recommend a short stack of pancakes to share with the table.

Cute spot for breakfast.  Order at counter and they bring food to your table.  I ordered a maple latte and Marigold Breakfast Sandwich.  Fried egg, cheddar-spiked boursin, bacon, tomato and green onion on toasted ciabatta.  It was good but not to die for.  Would return to try some of their other breakfast items.

Probably one of the top two breakfasts to be had in Madison. Fresh, delicious and with lots of choices, as well as healthy options. It's nice to get locally grown food when you eat out so this is a plus for Marigold. Not too expensive either. We paid the same price for breakfast for three that we do at Denny's (a guilty pleasure!).

My best friend and I have started a Wednesday brunch tradition, and Marigold was our destination today.   I ordered their pancake special, which happened to be toasted coconut pancakes, a strawberry scone, and a cup of coffee. Hands down the best pancakes I have ever had! I usually don't care for overly sweet meals, but I couldn't help myself today. The short stack, which comes with two pancakes instead of four, was plenty! (I definitely would not have been able to eat any more than that).  Tons of berries, toasted coconut flakes, and a big glob of frosting in the middle. To die for!   Everything cost me just over $10, so I would say it's reasonably priced. Super cute little place, not overly busy (even though it was 1pm on a rainy Wednesday so I can't attest to the weekend crowd), and friendly staff. Would love to come back. :)

What a gem. We had breakfast here Sunday afternoon - the daily scramble came with leeks and veggies and whipped herbed ricotta. Potatoes were fantastic and definitely try the jams. Relaxed place to have brunch.

I can't believe I still haven't written a review on this delicious cute brunch place in Madison. Perhaps it is the long wait that has delayed my writing as well. Marigold is a gem in Madison, almost every item on the menu I've tried I enjoyed. I also really like the pastries they have - the scones are my favorite.  I wouldn't suggest this as a place for groups, 4 would be the maximum I would go with. Do be prepared to wait, they are small, and they are very VERY popular. However, the new system makes the waiting much more civilized.  1) Order at the counter 2) The waiter/waitress host will let you know when your seat is available.   I love the potatoes. very very very good. Breakfast sandwich - get it with the sunny side up and your world is complete. Duck confit salad - very good price and very nice and soft meat. oh so flavorful  I tried the chilquiles but I was disappointed that my chips were soggy.... The flavor was good but soggy chips are NOT MY THING :( I would definitely ask for chips on the side in the future....  So, come by with a small group, get the potatoes. wonderful breakfast! yes, it is available weekdays too!!
We love having brunch here. My advice is to get here early as you can to avoid a long wait in line and missing out on a seat. The french toast and omelettes are a couple favorites.

Tried Marigolds at the recommendation of our waitress at Graze (up the street) and was pretty impressed by the food. The sidewalk seating is nice in the morning and they did a great job of getting our food out quickly. I had the breakfast sandwich (fried egg, cheddar-spiked boursin, applewood smoked bacon, tomato and green onion on toasted ciabatta for $6.50) which was delicious and definitely big enough for a good breakfast.   Pros: fresh food, fast service Cons: busy on weekends, OJ a bit overpriced

The skillets are wonderful, unless of course your looking for something baked, then the specialty pancakes are simply fantastic.  Scones and baked goods are pretty much like everyone else's.  Bottomless coffee, crowded dining room, tons of atmosphere-- make this a 'must do' breakfast place in Madison.    Only downside...no Wi-Fi --  but it's more fun talking to you neighbor anyway!

"Don't believe the hype" -- Public Enemy  My friend Blair texted me like 15 minutes after I woke up with: "I am starving. Feel like early lunch, round 11, near the Capitol." If you haven't guessed from my 130 Yelp reviews, I love to eat, so even though I had a lot to do today, I said "yes" and really looked forward to it because of all the "buzz" and hype around MK.  Unfortunately, I found the place just didn't meet expectations, even though nothing was unobjectionable. I got the short stack and eggs, and there was nothing particularly amazing about this batter. Moreover, they suffer from The Harvest Problem - ridiculously small portions (in this case, circumference of pancake), though the prices are fair. Nothing exceptional to the eggs -- no seasoning, no creative mix of oils. My friend's egg salad was also so-so according to her.  Last, and this isn't a problem with just MK, but the acoustics make it really hard to have a regular-volume conversation. This is common with many capitol restaurants and has something to do with the architecture, lack of sound-absorbent material around.   Again: there's nothing 'bad' about MK, but there's nothing exceptional about it. Is it worth waiting in the lines that frequently form at "peak" lunch/brunch hours? I don't think so. And I think those lines also contribute to unwarranted buzz that the place must be great because the demand is so high. Long-term real estate prices in 2007, anyone?

Breakfast sandwich was fantastic.  Cappuccino, too.   I passed on the free hotel breakfast to find a real one and am so glad I did!  I happened to find the Marigold Kitchen using Yelp.  It was a perfect breakfast at 7:00 AM to begin my drive to Minneapolis.    I'm leaving with an Americano for the road.

Good food and great ambiance.  Quaint little place.  Great spot to stop at when you are done walking around the capitol for the Farmers Market.  Madison excels at breakfast so I can't say this is the best place but its worth a try.

I visited twice in a two day span for breakfast while in town for business. Food was consistently good if not spectacular. Breakfast options include mostly standard fare,.with fresh and local ingredients emphasized. Second morning they were out of the special, a duck confit hash, by midmorning. I went for the scrambler with chorizo and roasted peppers and it was ok, with eggs on the watery side. The orange marmalade was good...nice difference from standard jams.

I was in town for a business meeting for a week and discovered Marigold's on the last two days July 16-17, 2011.  The breakfast was phenomenal.  I had a duck hash with dropped eggs and the second meal was their scrambler.  Both meals were cooked very well, and the service was surprisingly quick, considering how packed the restaurant was.  The staff were also very nice, and they have a nice side street location.....

It was good, but didn't impress me as much as the other breakfast place I've tried in Madison (Cafe Continental) considering the prices.  I got the smoked salmon eggs benedict, and it wasn't half bad, but at the price I would have expected better.  The eggs were too hard to be called poached.  The OJ was fresh-squeezed and great, but for $3.50 I would have expected more than the tiny cup it came in (I'm a spoiled Californian where oranges fall out of the sky).  I'd come back, but I'd get what my friends got; the omelets and scrambles were much more reasonably priced and looked delicious.

The service here is impeccable. My son changed his mind on his order after seeing someone else's plate. His original order was almost done. The waitress made the change without any hesitation. That kind of service on a super busy day shows her true character.   The food was good as well. The Almond Hazelnut Mocha is heaven in a cup. I'm not a big breakfast person, but I would go back just for that drink.   I will say the negative remarks on here almost scared me into not trying the place. But I think it's worth a try to find out for yourself.

This capital-area brunch and breakfast spot is perfect for catching up with girlfriends over a warm cup of coffee and stack of pancakes. The hipster-chic, cute dining area is perfectly complemented with exceptional food and great service.  It shouldn't be any surprise to the customer that Marigold is always so busy! Its location, food quality and service all help explain why you might need to wait a few minutes for a table. However, in my experience it has always been well worth the wait.

So on my first visit to Marigold I had very high expectations. I have to say that most all of them were met. This place is pretty cool! I was here at 10 AM on a Saturday and we got a table right away. My mom and I both ordered a Cafe Miel and Chipotle Chorizo Scone to start our meal. The lattes were amazing, definitely one of the best I've had. The scone was also delicious - not dry at all and the melted cheese on top was divine.   For my meal I ordered the special Asiago and Herb Crusted French Toast. Here's where my only issue came. When my plate came there were no fig preserves on it. However I was so hungry that I didn't even notice until after I was done eating! My plate was clean, when I saw another order come out that had fig preserves. Bummer because it probably would have made it that much more delicious! It was clearly yummy enough either way as I finished my plate pretty quick. The Arugula salad was a great complement to the rich french toast.  My mom ordered the Tofu Scrambler and enjoyed her meal as well. The ambiance of this place is really cute and homey. I guess I'll just have to return and try the dish as its' supposed to be eaten, hopefully they don't forget the jam this time.

Slightly upscale breakfast place with a little more casual atmosphere. It's a bit over-hyped.   Very busy on a Saturday morning and inside of restaurant was very warm (not enough A/C?)  Green tea was nice. I like that it was served with a tea pot and the hot water was self serve   The sweet potato&kale hash was great. Would have been amazing if there was other options on the table besides Tabasco. The greens were a great addition.   The Whole Grain Soy Sauté was okay...It was a small dish. Could barely taste the whole grain in there (would be great if there was more barley and quinoa in it). The mushrooms in the dish were great, but overall the taste wasn't anything spectacular. Would have loved a side of potatoes to go with it--or even toast--to make it more of a breakfast feel.
Messed up my order, over charged me, and the counter staff was rude. Thanks for making my birthday memorable!

One of my favorite brunch places. First time I went, the line was out the door. Most times though, it's just a little crowded. I guess that's what happens when they're not open on Sundays. Usually by the time you order, you can get a seat. And if not, they're pretty organized about getting everyone seated before their food is ready. I only get the scrambler because the Marigold potatoes are my absolute favorite, but my friends love the pancakes and the breakfast sandwich.

Breakfast is BOSS.  Marigold is fantastic for business coffee or breakfast. If there's a "deal on the table"...you'll be setting yourself up for success over Marigold breakfast.  This restaurant was opened by the same team that owns Sardine Restaurant (Willy St) and Gates and Brovi (Monroe St) and it is a sparkling, but small, gem.   MK doesn't receive 5 stars because major congestion can accumulate at the registers and mobility will be of major concern. This also occurs at various times in the dining space due to close proximity of the tables.   The toast can be burned around the edges at times, but I have no qualms with it...slab a little egg yolk or jam on them, and you won't notice (plus, it's toast, deal with it).   If you're a brunch aficionado, you understand some types of breakfast potatoes can flavor-cover your tongue and make your coffee taste a bit funky. This is the case with MK, but again, I haven't been phased by it.  Their seasonal pancake selection is EVERYTHING, and their coffee is often on point. Usually, during quieter crowd times, I am able to grab a coffee, sit and sip while I wait for my late-arriving group, or mull over food decisions, then head back to the register, order, and pay.   Other food recommendations include the MK breakfast sandwich is always a tasty fall-back. As with the toast, you want to make sure the bread is properly toasted, or I would recommend the poached egg prosciutto with rosemary toast..  Now stop readying, and go eat some MK breakfast!!!

Wow, what a madhouse! We came here at around 10am on a Saturday morning, and literally every available space in the restaurant was filled with people standing, waiting for a table. Apparently that is the standard state of affairs, so if extreme crowds are not your thing I would suggest staying away from the Marigold Kitchen. Once we did eventually place our order and sit down, all was good. My pumpkin spice pancakes were undercooked, so I want to try to give this place another shot when it is less busy.

I am in town with a big group and we were starving, so I yelped and we headed to Marigold for brunch/lunch/whatever. I didn't know it would be the order at the counter type of joint but that was fine with me, I love places like that. The atmosphere was cozy and cute albeit LOUD. It was hard to hear people at the other end of our table. I loved the menu - full of fresh dairy and produce from the land of cheese! I had an omelet with veggies and cheese, with salad, wheat toast and fruit. It was delicious. And a nice sized portion - enough for me (I am a big eater), but not so much that I was stuffed when I finished. The salad was awesome, the dressing was so light and it was the perfect amount. And the fruit was light on gross melon. Bueno.   I would say the only thing I didn't like was that in our group the food took a widely varying time to come out - I would estimate that the first person got her food maybe 15 minutes before the last person. That is somewhat rude. Otherwise I would definitely come back all the time if I lived here, and next time I'm in town I will come back!
