I consider myself to be a connoisseur of grilled cheese and the smoked turkey grilled cheese at Marigold Kitchen knocked my proverbial socks off (even though I was wearing flip flops)!  A delicious, yet unexpected combo of smoked turkey, Havarti cheese, and fig jam (WOW) combined to make a super tasty sandwich (I removed the Dijon mustard).  I think that the fig jam made it!  Despite my best efforts, I grabbed a chocolate chip cookie to-go...also delicious!  As far as atmosphere, they have a nice seating area outside (when weather permits) and the inside was nice and boisterous.  Really liked the employees - nice...and quick!  If I lived in Madison, Marigold Kitchen would be on my regular lunch rotation.
Great place! Fab food! Their brunch drinks are great! A must visit for anyone visiting Madison!!! Go early

Possibly the best breakfast/brunch spot in town. It gets my vote anyhow. I think my only criticism is that it's not the coziest place in the world.  A little loud, busy and sterile.  But some people are into that aesthetic.

I love this hidden jem. Their salad is so far the best in the town. It's got the visual appealing, right volume, right amount of dressing, and healthy good. I have yet to try their breakfast menu, but I'll definitely have it soon. The cafe interior decor is minimal, yet clean and stylish - type of a place hard to find in Madison. One negative was their Bloody Marry that accompanied my salad. I get the "home-made" recipe, but it just didn't taste as good as I hoped. The fresh-squeezed lemonade, on the other hand, is always excellent and refreshing.  Update - I just had another fab lunch here with my friend today. While I stuck with my regular order of Marigold salad, my friend opted for the beefy 1/2 lbs burger. I had a little portion of the gigantic burger. It was super delicious. I once again fell in love with this place. You can tell that they care about the ingredients, and it shows on everything they create in the kitchen.

In love with this place. For openers, coffee is great and you serve yourself so you never have to wait on that much needed pick me up refill after a night on the town. I always get the duck confit hash. Heaven on a plate. The French toast and pancakes also pack a sweet little punch. The staff is nice and efficient enough to keep that ever growing line moving. No downsides but expect to have your space unintentionally invaded as the place is smaller than the hungry crowds. If you don't like eating here, you should get your attitude and tastebuds a talking to.

Love this place! Next time we're back in Madison, Marigold Kitchen will be on our must-stop list for brunch. We had two of the specials. The eggs were fluffy and creamy and cooked perfectly with pancetta, ricotta, herbs and Parmesan.  The granola pancakes were amazing with honey butter and berries. The menu is full of unique, delicious options - hard to decide!

Marigold Kitchen has had a line out the door every day that we've been here visiting Madison, Wi. However, early Tuesday morning we found it comfortably busy with plenty of seating. You order at the counter and then have a seat with your table number. The service was excellent and the menu very diverse...it was hard to choose my breakfast. A great vibe. Worth the wait for slower crowd during the week but if you're here on the weekend only then take the time to get in line.

I've been to this place at least four times during the eight weeks I've been in Madison. The food is FANTASTIC, and the portion sizes are really generous, I really do feel like the value is worth it. You do order at the counter, which can be annoying and cumbersome if you want to order another thing, you have to get on the line again. Sometimes there won't be a line but sometimes there will be a really long line, so that's the only con. The food and the vibe are so, so so great. Top 5 brunch places in the world.

We wandered in early on a Saturday with no idea how this place worked, so I waited in line to ask and understood that  you order, tell someone (no idea who) how many are in your party , and then you wait.     Meanwhile my husband sat himself at the counter.  This was the wrong way to be seated,  but he wasn't moving.  I went to get his order, told a random person there were two of us, then went back to place the order, completely misunderstood my total bill, apologized, paid, and got a number.  Then I got coffee, which I REALLY needed that morning.     The food was delivered to us more quickly than I expected, and my omelette was excellent.   We ate and got out in record time because you just don't want to linger here.  It feels cramped.     Also note that it is not a cheap breakfast.  A side of bacon was $9.  It was very good bacon....but it was $9.
One of my favorite stops for a sandwich and soup. It is usually very busy but I've always been able to get a seat and enjoy a variety of sandwiches and soups. It is a delight.
Love their salads and sandwiches for lunch!

Went for brunch.  I should have trusted my instincts and walked out upon seeing the price for biscuits and gravy = $12.  Instead,  we stayed and had a good--though seriously overpriced and undersized--meal.  My french toast was $10.  Tasty, to be sure, great fluffy texture, cooked perfectly, with several nice sauces poured over the little pile.  And I might've been ok with the price if only there were more on the plate.  But only three triangles of french toast?  Where was the fourth?  (On someone else's plate, I had to assume.)    What sense does it make to deprive me of that half-slice of French toast?  Surely not pricing sense, as it couldn't cost much of anything.  The berries on the plate were ripe and plump.  But there were a total of two black berries and two raspberries.  For color, I guess.  Can't praise the quality of the link sausages.  A side of three sausages were an extra $3.  They weren't bad.  They were just small, with the most pedestrian flavor, no smoke, no spice, no herbs.  Cooked.  That's all one could really say about them.  So at $13 my plate left me pretty hungry and very sad.  I perfectly expect to pay prices like that for farm to table restaurant food.  But don't let me walk away sad.

Mozart in the kitchen, Salieri in the front of house  A visit to Marigold Kitchen is both a transcendent and vexing proposition.    REGARDING THE KITCHEN:  For me, Marigold slings the best breakfast food in Madison, bar none.  After 200+ reviews of this establishment, I know I'm not going to break any new ground, but every time I visit, they nail both the composition and the execution of the dish.  The ingredients are right from the farm fresh, the flavors balanced and the plating divine.  With every bite I take, I hear the voice of God.  Displace one item from the plate and there would be diminishment - add one item to the plate and the structure would fail.   It's rainbows, unicorns and a heaping dose of fairy dust.  I love the elegant duck confit hash, the rustic scramblers, the hearty French toast, the exquisite potatoes...I LOVE ALL THEIR FOOD!!!   REGARDING THE FRONT OF HOUSE:  ARRRRRRRRRGGGGH [shaking fist at the heavens, Mozart's Requiem roaring the background...]  Marigold Kitchen, WHY must you vex me so???  You ply me with food prepared by angels, then mock me by serving it in your miniscule dining room where I unable to partake in a casual conversation over the dull roar of the other patrons.  Why do you force my to squeeze through a maze of densely packed tables every time I need to refill my coffee or grab a napkin when another diner has bumped into my table in their haste to grab an open table, knocking over said beverage.  Why is it that other prospective diners, perching like vultures in the waiting area, eye me like a wounded wildebeest, wondering when I am going give up my table.    I'm seriously considering starting a Kickstarter campaign so these guys can get a bigger dining room - who's with me?

Amazing service, fantastic bread, and perfect omelette.  We had 18 people show up on a Sunday morning and somehow despite the huge popularity of his tiny place they seated us together and promptly and cheerfully served us fresh and wArm delicious food! Don't skip the carbs you have to try the bread! Really good coffee, too.

Marigold is as good as it gets in Madison.  They have been Madison's best lunch spot since they opened about 15 years ago.  Management is superior here and they know how to pick staff.  Food is spectacular and they are continually tweaking the menu and clearly put a lot of thought into daily specials.  I can rely on Marigold Kitchen for a business meeting, or lunch with friends, and I know it will be consistently excellent.  The only cons to Marigold are how popular it is, which can lead to a bit of a wait in line.  Staff does a great job of making sure people don't walk in and stake a claim to a table before they actually order food, but occasionally you may have to wait for a table.  Worth it!
Ordered a tofu scramble to go - received 1/2 cup of tomato based slop with some corn, beans and tofu. Overpriced and not impressed. However, I have heard the breakfast sandwich to go is good.

Came here for breakfast on a recent visit to Madison.  Split the french toast and artichoke omelet with a friend.  Both were amazing.  They even let me bring my new puppy (we had to sit outside).  Only issue was that the sun was blazing and they didn't have any umbrellas for outdoor seating.  We waited until there was a bit of shade behind a tiny, skinny tree and sat down.  Would have been much better with an umbrella, but the food was great.

I headed to Marigold on a nice weekend morning and was pleasantly surprised. This restaurant is small, but comfy, and they have delicious food. I also like how you order and find a seat versus having a server, much more convenient. My friends and I sat at a window table and absolutely loved sun-soaking while enjoying breakfast. Would recommend!
duck confit hash = so amazing that i choked on it from greedy inhaling

As an out-of-towner who is a self proclaimed breakfast snob, Marigold Kitchen is legit.  You can tell a place is popular when every table is taken within 15 minutes of opening. Somehow even while being very busy, we were able to move through the order-at-the-counter line, find seats, and get our food within about 20 minutes. Pretty amazing.   All waitstaff were courteous and friendly. We talked with the staffer working the coffee station for recommendations and were very pleased with her recommendations. Thanks for your patience while we peppered you with questions.   The duck confit hash is not to be missed. The sweet and smokey flavors were balanced nicely with the pairing of the mixed green salad. I only wish I could eat it every week. The blueberry pancakes were a little sweet for me, but that didn't stop my partner from eating the entire shortstack.   Would certainly return next time we are in town. Thanks for doing breakfast right!

There are many, many places to get breakfast at all times in Madison. Marigold is at the top of the list. Our group of 3 had brioche french toast, oyster/asparagus frittata and sweet potato/kale/spinach two egg hash.  We would get them all again, beautifully prepared on a very busy day,  the veggies are fresh, the eggs right off the farm. And, they make a nice Mimosa.

Lived here for 5 years, ate out 700 times (ok I don't really know how many times), but only went here 3 times or so due to desire of variety for lunch.  This place is kind of ehhh for me due to it's high prices and smarmy quality.  Dammit! Why do you have to be so warm and cozy and yummy and perfect, yadda yadda.  Maybe I just want that certain level of imperfection when I dine out, but something about this place is kind of like nails on a chalkboard to my soul.  They DO have tasty food.  They DO have a decent atmosphere.    Cons: wait time during weekday lunch can be unbearable, high prices, can be very warm inside and hard to find a seat
Great breakfast...friendly service, and the coffee was smooth and delish.  Very nice place.
Really good food but a bit pricey. But what do you expect for downtown.

I was out here for a week and visited this place on four different occasions during my stay. Both the food and coffee was amazing. The maple latte in particular was my favorite. (My cup collection in the hotel room as proof)

WORTH THE WAIT!!!!  At Marigold, you order at the counter, receive a number and go find a seat. Despite the long line, food was timely and really fresh & delicious. My boyfriend was very happy with the food, talking about how much better it was than brunch places in our neighborhood in NYC. I'll post pictures of our breakfasts.  P.S. THE POTATOES ARE BANGIN!
Great food! Loved the ordering style because it made for a super fast table turnaround. The bacon is out of this world!
Had the spinach quiche and field greens.  Good tasting, but the quiche was a bit overdone.  I would definitely return, however, as the other menu items looked intriguing as well.

THIS JUST IN: You can get a short stack! WHAAAAAAAA? I'm constantly overwhelmed by the sweet their pancakes punch, but get this, you can get a wee stack of two for a few buck when typically the larger portion runs $10. SOLD! Does it say this on the menu somewhere? It's possible. But you're reading Yelp, and now you know, so you don't need to eye over the menu closely. Simply peep the chalkboard, decide that the special pancakes are the best being offered, then grab a short stack!
Marigold takes brunch to a different level.   It's the same old breakfast items you enjoy, but with a fresh twist.  They can make salads for breakfast en Vogue.   Try it out.

A solid 4 1/2 stars!  Consistently a winner in delivering great food in an inviting and clean atmosphere.  I usually go early as to avoid the lines and to  be seated immediately.....really busy during farmers market Saturdays.  Outside dining (I believe) is still available depending on weather.  On most occasions, my dining partner and I order the scrambler and pancake specials of the day along with our coffee.  We share and get the ideal sweet and savory portions for our meal.  The coffee is always hot and fresh.  If you're looking for a varied menu, tasty bakery items and a great atmosphere, you can't go wrong, Marigold Kitchen is awesome!

Let me begin this by saying the food here is great. Really, really great. If you want a delicious breakfast, go to Marigold Kitchen.  However, I can't give them five stars - or even four - because the staff are just so incredibly rude. I have never been treated like anything other than a nuisance when placing my order. I used to bring out-of-town guests here but no more. It's simply too embarrassing to have them treated like crap for ordering a Diet Coke.   They also really need to do something about their seating policies. They are very, VERY uptight about the proper way to go about seating yourself, yet they don't just have a hostess to seat people. I don't understand it.
Every detail is considered - making breakfast special isn't easy in my book but they delivered.
Excellent French toast and quiche.  A down to earth, friendly, brunch and breakfast.  Recommended to us at the Hilton.  Good choice with a well deserved excellent reputation.

Kind of like a deli, but it's not super cheap.  Good if you're a on the square and in a hurry I suppose. For a leisurely breakfast, I'd suggest you look elsewhere.   The business model is that of a diner, minus the service and normal amount of space  (sounds like a winner, huh?). You come in, grab a piece of heavyweight, printed paper that claims to be a menu, and then you order. (Don't blink, the line moves fast.) Unlike a diner, the Marigold Kitchen isn't content to serve you french toast. No, they have to add nuts, 3 types of berries, some organic cheese and whatever. All the food  is like this. You may not get any service, but your plate looks good before you eat it. Food snob?--you'll love this.  Ambiance:  well it has the typical too trendy look to it. Every wall is painted some color that clashes with another. The seats and stools are uncomfortable, but look nice. And oh, don't miss the men's bathroom, it's the girliest thing I've ever seen.  ...Well, except for the double caged light fixture that looks like it belongs on a ship.   The staff:  clearly a look to them.  Seems like stereotypical co-op college lesbians.  Short hair, attitude, matching t-shirts, probably pit hair. If you have a problem with sexuality, that's your issue, not mine. I make note of it  because I don't care for stores where everyone looks the same. Y'know like TGIF's with its flair buttons? Hate that. Well, this is the same deal, but just another costume  Will you like the food?  Let's get serious. You don't go to this place for the food. Nonetheless, it gets a passing grade. I didn't throw up or anything.

I Love breakfast and Marigold is a great breakfast joint. Went here on a friend's suggestion and was not even disappointed in the slightest. One must recognize Marigold's setup before you come just so you don't get stressed for standing in line and ordering yourself.    We came on a Saturday mid-morning and the place was actually not a madhouse. Winning already. You walk in grab a menu and stand in line and order at the front. They give you a number and a few minutes later, boom food! The selection of goods Marigold hooks up is amazing.   We ordered a few items at Marigold. First up, the Marigold breakfast sandwich with potatoes as well as the house made bloody Mary and pancakes with orange whip butter.   The sandwich was so damn good. So satisfying on so many levels. It had a great cream cheese spread and an egg cooked perfectly with bacon. Simple yet scrumptious. The pancakes were also great and that orange marmalade butter! Woot Woot! The bloody Mary was really good. Not a ton of garnishes but a house made mix that was intense and packed with flavor! This is a must to get if you like bloodies!   Now for me, I probably had the best breakfast potatoes I ever had in my life! These things were the sleeper hit! I had no idea potatoes could be so decadent. They came out steaming hot and were crisp and had a perfect seasoning to them. Hands down I could get a plate of these alone and crush em!   Marigold I will be back again when I come to Madison. You are one solid breakfast joint in my book!

Just stopped in to grab breakfast to go - had a hard time deciding, but ended up ordering the Marigold Breakfast Sandwich. It was delicious. Fresh ciabatta, fried egg, thick bacon, topped with tomato and some magical creamy cheesy sauce. Green onions really set the whole thing off.    Fast friendly service, tasty breakfast... Thanks Marigold!

A great little place for brunch, but make sure to get here early or be prepared to wait for a table!  The food is really tasty, especially their omelets/scrambles. The potatoes are delicious and very flavorful. I haven't tried much else because I can't keep myself from ordering the scrambles! I recommend sharing if you get a scramble with brie in it, as they are VERY heavy and filling.  The ambiance makes me a bit anxious, which is the only reason I don't come here more often. If you're waiting for a table, you feel like you have to constantly watch people to see if they're leaving. You can order food even if there aren't tables available, in which case you might get your food and still be waiting for a table. That to me is not a pleasant experience. If you happen to get a table, others are watching you eat, hoping to snag your table the minute you finish eating. This does not make for the nicest atmosphere. I ordered take-out to avoid this once, but the food was not near as good as it is for dine-in so I wouldn't do that again. The bottom line is to get here as early as you can.  I wish they wouldn't take orders until a table was opening up, because then I'd happily give Marigold 4 or even 5 stars. The food is certainly some of the best in Madison, but it's hard to ignore the ambiance.

This was my first visit to Marigold and I will definitely be going back!  It is situated right off of the Capitol and easy to find, not being from Madison myself I found it with some simple directions from a friend. I walked in and was very excited to try what was on the menu since where I live most of these options would not be available.  Browsing the menu I saw a disclaimer stating the use of fresh and locally grown items.  I love this!   You order and pay at the counter, fill your own coffee cup, and seat yourself.  The place was about half full so I picked one of the stools facing out the window to people watch while I ate.  Shortly after my food arrived, three perfectly cooked pancakes with butter and sliced strawberries (which I was not expecting), and two huge sausage links.  Everything tasted great and the coffee was hot.   This is definitely a popular place!  People were in and out for take out orders, and the line was 7 or 8 people long a couple of times while I was there, which made getting another coffee a slight challenge but not impossible.   Overall, the experience was a great one!  Staff is very nice and helpful, the atmosphere is relaxed with other patrons enjoying their breakfast and conversation, and the food is tasty.  I will for sure being going here again when I am back in town.
It's 2:00 on a Friday afternoon. We are the only customers. We've been waiting for our food for 25 minutes. It better be good when it finally gets here.

The food here is so so good. I had a maple latte and the chili poached eggs. My mouth is watering just thinking about them. On a previous visit my husband ordered the weekend special which was some kind of ribs and grits and was also to die for. The only thing I don't like about this place is the awkward ordering/seating system. You order at the counter and then awkwardly wait around for someone to leave and then seat yourself. It ends up being really irritating when people who arrived after you are quick on their feet and steal a table right out from under you. Not my favorite, but I'll suffer through it just to eat their chili poached eggs again.

A 5 star breakfast place in a city riddled with average morning dining. Ive never had a problem getting a table on the weekdays. Service is fast and courteous. The breakfast sandwich was very good but with a tad too much mayo. The potatoes are the real star of the show though and I wouldnt never pass them up while there. The jam on the table is also stellar and a nice touch.  I would bring locals and family alike here!

My bf and I went here for Sunday brunch after a hockey and concert-filled weekend in Madison. Apparently the entire city decided to go here for brunch as well, as it appears to have that "trendy place for brunch" feel to it .  I appreciate that you wait in line, order your food, and then are seated by the wait staff.    My boyfriend was a little taken aback by his view from our table, as he unfortunately was seated facing the bathrooms, which was an incessant flow of Marigold patrons.  To add fuel to the fire, seating is tight and we may have just been seated right on top of the couple of savant schmucks seated right next to us who were either trying to 1.) vehemently impress us (or each other) with their vast knowledge or 2.) were never educated in respecting and acknowledging one's surroundings.  Nonetheless, moving on to the food, we each ordered our individual adult brunch platters, mine a delicious egg white marigold omelet, although the omelet was well-prepared, the potatoes leave something to be desired.  Since I also had my sinister sweet tooth nagging at me all morning I ordered a child's order of French toast as a side.  I was really disappointed when one of the wait staff stopped by our table to let us know that they don't allow adults to order from the children's menu.  We however thought it would be okay since we had each ordered our own dish--needless to say, this was the icing on the cake, the bow on present, and the kick to the stomach when you're already down.  So aside from the potty-view, idiot-savants, and child's French toast tidbit, I'd say that this place is okay for my ONE and ONLY time there.  Better luck for the next guy!

This is another restaurant where I honestly don't understand the hype that's built up around it.   I've eaten here twice now, and both times have been extremely underwhelming. As always, I'm dealing with a nut allergy, and it really shouldn't be hard to find food that I can eat. The staff, and cooks (!), have no real knowledge of the ingredients that they use and what goes into what dish.   The first time I ordered French toast. That should be a nice safe dish. Nope. Has some kind of almond something. They then had to make the toast step by step to make sure they weren't missing some somewhere else. The food was ok, but I mean, it's French toast. I could have gotten the same thing from Dennys and not notice the difference.   Today I ordered an open face tuna melt. I don't know about anyone else, but when you add the word "melt" to a sandwich I kind of start assuming it's going to be hot. You know, to melt the cheese. You'd be mistaken in this scenario because it was cold tuna on cold bread with a cold greasy not fully melted cheese square. It's a personal preference, but the pickle slices on it was a sweet pickle and that's always kind of horrifying for me. The tuna, like the French toast, could have been from anywhere and honestly tasted like the kind you'd get from Subway. It's served with an arugula salad with a champagne vinaigrette, which could be described as "a bitter oily mass of sadness".   My husband ordered the Chili Roasted Chicken sandwich, which he enjoyed. He also got their puree of mushroom soup, which neither of us enjoyed. For some unexplainable reason, it had a tomato base. It was brownish red, and didn't have even a hint of mushroom flavor. It was also served lukewarm, which didn't help endear it to us.   I can't recommend eating here. Our bill for 2 sandwiches and a cup of soup was $27. Considering the taste and experience, it's very much not worth it.

CHOAS!!!! Complete and total CHOAS.  People crashing into each other, food falling on the floor, drinks spilled constantly. The food was good but the place was HORRIBLY managed or better yet completely UNMANAGED. No thanks not again. Tried the zucchini pancakes and they were good experience was awful.
Best french toast I've ever had.  Expect a little bit of a wait but well worth it.

Every single time I come to Madison, WI I cannot wait to get here on Saturday morning! The have literally some of the yummiest breakfast I've ever had, EVER!!   TRY a Scone!!  You cannot go wrong with their scones. wonderful combos such as blackberry peach...mmmmm....  Their breakfast sandwich is the BEST breakfast sandwich I've ever had. I have the hardest time NOT ordering it when I'm there, thank you to my brother-in-law for getting me addicted to it. ;)  My in-laws are regulars here as they always find the staff super friendly, inviting, helpful & really what you'd expect for a small restaurant near the square...can we say quality?!  As long as this place stands I will be there every trip I take to Madison.
Amazing food, great coffee, and inviting atmosphere. A must for anyone visiting Madison.

The food was excellent. We walked in here randomly but was not disappointed.  Ordered the scrambler and a ham and parsley omelette.  Both were very good but were too close in taste.  Wish I would have tried something different.
My husband would give this restaurant 6 stars if he could :)  We enjoyed the breakfast and lunch we had here very much and highly recommend it!  Cool vibe too.

Easily in my top 5 restaurants in Madison. Ideal little pocket cafe has fresh breakfast and lunch options that keep me coming back almost weekly. I cannot get enough of their signature Marigold Salad (throw in Salmon, trust me) and I often struggle ordering between that and their daily specials. Their soups are really the star. Wholesome and delicious and can be split into half and half options so you can try everything.

Marigold Kitchen is definitely a great brunch option in downtown Madison! I went here with a friend on a Saturday morning after the Dane County Farmers Market. If I had any doubt of whether Marigold would be good, the full tables and line almost to the door answered that question for me. Despite being so busy, by the time we had placed our order, a table opened up and we could sit down right away.  We treated ourselves to mimosas, which were great (!) and the perfect thing to sip on while we waited for our food. The scrambler of the day was delicious (although I can't remember exactly what was in it). I will gladly return to Marigold Kitchen!

The food was average but way overpriced, this is probably because this restaurant is very close to the Capitol and in the high rent area of town.  Bacon was soggy and portions were small.  Prices were HIGH, $30 for two people for a basic two egg breakfast with coffee!  I promise we won't be heading back there anytime soon!  Unfortunately, our favorite spot was closed because it was Monday.  Would not recommend!

Came in with a friend for some breakfast. You order at the counter, find a table and they bring you the food. I ordered the honey buckwheat pancakes, an egg and bacon. The pancakes were very dry. Maple syrup was good and the pancakes had bananas cooked in them. The taste was good, just sooo dry!  My friend had the duck confit hash. Big chunks of potato and duck. He said it was ok. Nice portions, but somewhat disappointed.

Great place, great location, friendly staff, fantastic food. One big complaint: too noisy. WAY too noisy.   Favorite dish: the quiche, but if you want it for lunch,  get there early as it sells out quick if there is any left from breakfast.

OMG I love this place, best breakfast place I've been to in Madison so far. The duck confit was amazing. They are super busy but the wait was totally worth it.  Service was fast and friendly. I went when it was still a little warm outside when they had outdoor seating and the waitress still checked on us regularly. I will definitely go back.  =)

Marigold's takes the cake for the most delicious poached eggs I've ever had.  Talk about a food memory, I was here for a conference weeks ago and I can still remember the chili poached eggs with prosciutto and manchego cheese.  And with coffee and a tip, it was still less than $12.  Fan-tas-tic.  The place is sunny and clean, the staff is friendly, and everyone at my table was blown away by the quality of their food.  I was particularly jealous of my friend's French toast, which was piled high with berries and looked truly excellent.  Definitely worth a stop-in for brunch!

I've been to Marigold Kitchen a couple of times. The place could get busy sometimes, but fortunately we always managed to get seats. You have to order food from the counter and wait to be seated after. That being said, seating could get messy sometimes when people just come in and didn't want to stay in line to get seated. Also, if you order drinks, make sure to tell them NOT to make it before u get seated or you will end up standing around holding your drink.  I tried the scrambler and two eggs (with 4 fat strips of bacon with only $2 more). The egg dishes was ok - but they were served with Marigold's potatoes - which was the real gold!! It's seasoned beautifully (I still can't figure out what's on it) and really I don't mind ordering anything from this place that comes with the potatoes. The portion was BIG; I always have to box a portion of my food.    The last time I was here, I wanted to try the Duck Hash confit. Unfortunately, it doesn't come with Marigold's potatoes. I did ask the employee about the potatoes, but she didn't seem too friendly about it :(
Lavender latte is beautiful. Duck confit hash is sweeter than expected, pancake is very nice!

Really good place by the capital. Espresso coffees, fresh made egg dishes and pancakes, great service (but note it's an order and sit place). Really liked the duck con fit potatoes with poached eggs and mixed green salad - but have to admit that I was hoping for more "duck". My wife had the egg scramble with red potatoes - the eggs were very good and reminded me of chilaquiles with Mexican queso on top. That was the best I think. My son then ordered the little pancakes which he liked.   I ordered a nice iced coffee which was nice and refreshing. We also sat outside since it was a nice day by the capital. Will come again for sure and try more.
My new favorite and on my list of restaurants to frequent!  The food is great and at a good price and the customer service can't be beat!

The food is always fresh and flavorful here! The menu is concise, which makes your wait time in line for the counter shorter. And all of their items are super colorful and have interlocking flavors that get nailed on the head. The atmosphere is classic and cozy warm which makes you want to stay a while. but they try to flip tables quick because they have lots of customers around peak times.My only complaint is how long it takes to make the food since you do order at the counter. Definitely a favorite lunch stop during summer months!

We were starving when we had arrived at Marigold Kitchen, which came at a recommendation from our friend who lives in Madison for breakfast. Our timing was good as after we ordered the line was out the door even with the 100+ degree weather.  I dig the concept of ordering your food then grabbing a table.   When I got to the cash register I ordered a staple - eggs, potatoes and bacon with a side pancake. Eggs and bacon were good though the potatoes were amazing. They were scalloped, salted and crispy on the edges. The pancake was fluffy and big with some strawberries and butter and syrup -not bad for an extra $2.  I would go back if I were to visit Madison again though my only gripe was that my food was warm and the others were cold, which was surprising given that the food is made and served to order.

Great options for breakfast and feasibly priced. Parking is tricky in downtown Madison. So many strange rules and signs make no sense. They kind of contradict each other. When in doubt just park in one of the garages.  This place open early and probably the best to go because there are not many tables.  You order at the counter and your food arrives to your table based upon a number assigned.  The fresh squeeze OJ is pretty good except it would be nice if the squeeze it in front of you. It will make harder but a nice touch.

This place is always a go to for breakfast or brunch. I try to go during the week to avoid the impossible crowds that come with the weekends but sometimes you have those needs that only Marigolds can fix.   I am going to be 100% honest I have never even looked at the menu. I always see their daily scrambler special and I don't have to look any further. Their scramblers have fresh ingredients so they vary with the seasons. You get their delicious breakfast potatoes (add a bit of siracha and you will die and go to heaven) and a side of toast.   A couple notes about this place is that it's an order at the front get your own coffee and water kind of place. Personally I love this aspect and makes it easy to eat with friends and in larger groups. But if you are trying to get served you might want to try The Great Dane across the street. Also don't fret if there doesn't seem to be a seat open when you walk in. People come in eat and leave so odds are by the time you get through ordering something will open up and most certainly something will by the time your food is ready.   Also disclaimer the only reason it's not a 5 star is because my most recent experience there the plating was just sloppy and a bit smaller portions than usual. I might be holding them up to too high of standards but when I come here I know that I can expect the best.

Oh Marigold how I love your pancakes and your breakfast sandwich and your coffee... And well, everything you create.  I've been to Marigold Kitchen a couple of times and I have never been disappointed. It really is one of my favorite places to eat breakfast/ brunch at.   If you go on the weekend it may be busy with lots of people and don't worry if there is a line it is so worth it and it usually goes pretty fast.   You will have to order at the register before sitting down which is different at first but some how the timing is always perfect on the open table to ordering ratio.   The food is amazing! They have the best pancakes and usually have some sort of pancake concoction on special. (It's always delicious get it!!)  I also recommend the best breakfast sandwich in town ( egg, tomato, bacon, cream cheese, and so much more)  I personally go with someone and split the sandwich and the pancakes so my tastebuds get the best of both worlds. Also you can't forget the homemade American fries. They are also delicious!  If you order any coffee or drink they are made with great detail and the presentation are always fun to see.   I highly recommend Marigold Kitchen. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

Nice little place just off of the capital square.  High quality ingredients.  Had the '"Cured salami, ham, and provolone  with spicy olive relish, romaine and aioli on ciabatta  8.99  "  Good value for the money.  Service was quick and the staff friendly.

The Marigold has the best breakfast anywhere--period.  The food here puts Milwaukee's "Blue's Egg" to shame so badly that I would drive to Madison and back just because Marigold is that much better.    The pancakes with the lemon ricotta?  Um, yes, please!  They are goodness in flapjack form!    The scrambles are always fresh, inventive, and perfectly cooked.  Marigold does not overcook their eggs.  This is cause for great joy!  The omelets are fantastic, too.  My favorite is the Chorizo sausage, roasted sweet corn relish, and sharp cheddar (I skip the cilantro)...which simply sings.  I generally avoid places where you have to walk up, order, then fight for a table--but the food here is *SO* good that I make an exception.  Have breakfast or brunch at the Marigold.  If you go on a weekend, be prepared to wait.  If you can't deal with the wait, go on a weekday or during a tsunami or something.  There are people standing around waiting because the food is incredibly delectable.
Excellent quality food, large portions. Very tasty, I had the duck confit and it was amazing. They have Outside seating during the summer to enjoy beautiful weather.

I had the French toast and it was delicious, possibly the best I've ever had. My boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed his scrambled eggs special. Took off a star simply because the coffee wasnt very good but this is a lovely place with great food. Would def recommend!
casual atmosphere, good prices, and fresh ingredients in the hands of able cooks. Its enjoyable every time i've been there.
A very relaxing place on weekdays. Loved the iced mint latte, which had a lot of peppermint leaves within the drink, and the coffee also smelled really good!

My favorite breakfast/brunch place in the Midwest. The ambience is perfect with plenty of light and a comfortable variety of seating options. The french toast is perfect and the breakfast sandwich is incredible.

Stopped in for breakfast while visiting Madison. Very good food and a great atmosphere. I had a scrambler and hot chocolate. The food was very nice arriving with a side of potatoes and toast. The scrambler was a little bit runny but very good with ham, tomatoes, spinach, poblano peppers and cheddar cheese. The hot chocolate was unexpectedly excellent. I'd definitely eat here again.

This place is becoming one of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots in Madison! Rather than a 'sit down first and order from your waiter'-type of place, you immediately look at the menu when you walk in, decide what you want, and place your order with the cashier at the counter. They give you a number, and another worker either brings you to a table or you wait off to the side (where they have chairs along the wall) until someone directs you to an empty table. From there, you can serve yourself some water, and you wait until your food is delivered to you!  The first time I visited, my mom and I split a sweet entree and a savory entree. We had the egg scrambler on special which came with breakfast potatoes and toast, as well as the french toast. The scrambler was good, the potatoes were great, and that french toast was the absolute BEST! It's got this almond-flavored cream on top of it with fresh berries, and it is oh so heavenly. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a sweet meal!  This morning, we were in luck that the line was only a couple people long considering it was about 1130 on a Sunday morning. We placed our order within a few minutes and were placed immediately at a table, and it didn't take too long for our food to arrive. My friend had the Marigold Breakfast Sandwich and loved it!! She said the best part was the creamy spread on it -- which we later realized was the boursin cheese (which is very similar to cream cheese). I tried the Roasted Sweet Potato, Kale, and Basil Walnut Pesto Hash and my oh my that was deeeeeelicious!! I might be biased since sweet potatoes are my absolute favorite, but it was so good. There were plenty of roasted sweet potatoes in the mix, along with some baby reds, carrots, onions, and pesto. I chose to have the hash with poached eggs, which were perfectly runny on the inside. I love how the egg yolk kind of blends into everything in the hash -- it makes it that much better! On the side came a field mix with champagne vinaigrette -- the greens were a bit soaked in the dressing which became overpowering at times, but they were still decent. I was hoping that my plate would have had a bit more of the hash on it -- the portion size wasn't small by any means, but a little more would have been perfect.   Lastly, we decided to order a short stack of the Citrus Ricotta pancakes that were on special this weekend. We didn't know if we'd have to get back in like and forfeit our table in order to get another item, but luckily we asked one of the workers and she was able to ring up our order right away while we were still at our table! That worked out perfectly. The pancakes were insanely good -- super fluffy, with crystallized orange zest and what seemed like citrus-y butter on the top and maple syrup on the side. I would definitely get them again as a little side item to split with whoever else at the table!!  Overall, you can't go wrong with Marigold. This place might be turning into my go-to brunch spot!!

Thanks to Yelp, we found this place for brunch on a beautiful Sunday in Madison. We arrived half an hour after they opened, and they were already packed.  Something to get used to was ordering from the counter before you can grab a seat---I can see this being chaotic in spite of an "brunch etiquette" sign posted inside.    The artichoke omelette I ordered was served generously with toast, house potatoes and mixed greens.  Next time, I will order the breakfast sandwich that looked scrumptious from across the table. It took all of me not to order from their pastry selection but my husband did grab a few of their cinnamon doughnuts.    Friendly service and decent coffee drinks made this an excellent choice.

ate here twice in one weekend... once for a catered dinner and once for sunday brunch.  unlike the masses, i preferred the former.  i could've eaten a whole plateful of the passed fig/cheese crostini apps.  the salad was perfectly dressed - slightly tart, completely delicious dressing.  i had one of the best catered vegi meals - mushrooms on top of polenta.  every bite was the perfect herbey blend without being over the top in salt or butter (as a lot of polenta dishes tend to be).   take 2...brunch.  absolutely loved the atmosphere and mini pots of tea (green tea was excellent), however i think the overall selection was mediocre.  i guess i was hoping for some more savory dishes outside of the egg family since i normally avoid them.  i settled for the scrambler which again was mediocre.  the rosemary bread that came with it was quite delicious though.  all in all, i would totally recommend this adorable spot - great location by the capitol and quick service.

This place is darling and seriously delicious. My boyfriend and I came on a weekend around 12ish. It was busy but there were a few tables open. I personally like the whole pay-at-the-counter thing. It's just easy. Coffee is self serve and AWESOME. Really strong, just the way I like it.   I'm giving this place 5 stars because the food was really top-notch. Such fresh, quality ingredients...you can truly taste the difference. I got the french toast and it blew my mind. My boyfriend got one of the omelettes and was in love as well. I stole one of his potatoes and it alone was pretty amazing. Plus it's really cute inside. :)  Will be coming back when I'm back in Madison!

I'm from Houston, so by my standards, this place is TINY. Like, my bedroom is probably bigger than their dining area.   I went in on Pi Day 2015 for breakfast around 10am. The place was already super packed, with a line extending to the door. Unlike in Houston, you order your food and pay first, and then you have to wait for a table. Interesting concept, and one I've never seen before in Texas. We had to wait 15-20 minutes for the table, but the upside was that the food came out pretty soon after that.   I got the spinach and gouda quiche with the side of greens tossed in champagne vinaigrette. They only give you a slice of quiche, not a mini-quiche like most breakfast places, but it was a BIG slice and very tall. It was pretty good, I would order it again. While I did not sample the side of greens, my friends did, and they said the greens tasted weird. My friends liked their food too (ham sandwich and beef, eggs, and potatoes).  Overall a pretty good experience, albeit different from Texas restaurants.

Great breakfast... best I've had on the road in a long time.  I had the veggie quiche with field greens and it was awesome.  The crust was cooked to perfection... golden brown but not a hint of burnt.    Love the ambiance - it's like a coffee shop for breakfast.

I really have to get something off my chest. I love breakfast. But I also love sleeping in. So you can see I have a problem. But that's why there is brunch. Brunch solves the problems of hungry pillow huggers everywhere. So thank you, Brunch creator. Wherever you are. Whew, ok. Now, here's the review...  Marigold Kitchen was recommended by my sister who is a Madison-ite. We were perusing the Dane County Farmers Market during the summer and she suggested we meet up with some of her coworkers and have a quick bite. Marigold's was paaaaacked. The line was out the door. There's no wait-to-be-seated area, it's a order at the front (well, the side) and find a table if you can. The waiters are definitely helpful in scouting out a spot, but it can be chaotic if you're unprepared. Luckily, we found a nice spot outside on their tiny little sidewalk patio.   I'm a slave to good French Toast, so it wasn't even a question of what I would order. We also ordered a giant carafe of orange juice which was tasty, but nothing I've have better. For the French Toast bread they use awesome brioche. They had lightly drizzled sweet cream on top with a mixture of fresh summer berries that included strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries. Slivered almonds and a side of maple syrup completed the French Toast. It was...delectable. Perfectly crisp on the outside, but thoroughly cooked yet moist on the inside. The sweet cream and berries were perfect without the syrup. But I prefer not-so-sweet breakfast, errr...brunch items. My sister had the Duck Confit Hash which she raved about. I'm not a duck fan, so I opted out of trying. But I'll take her word for it. The French Toast was more than enough for me to 5* review this place.

Delicious food, with lots of vegetarian options for the not-do-meat-inclined of Wisconsin. All the food choices are thoughtfully constructed and interesting, which is unusual for a breakfast joint. It's a little on the pricier side for breakfast, but worth it for the quality. It's cute enough inside, but certainly doesn't have the in-your-face personality that some of the Madison breakfast spots go for in the interior design.

Best breakfast I've eaten in Madison by FAR. If you hear someone saying the food is not good they're lying or just don't know what good food is. I've eaten food from New York to California and I can say unequivocally Marigolds is one of the vey best breakfast spots I've ever eaten at. To give a frame of reference, if you have ever been to Chicago and eaten at Batter N Berries or Over Easy Cafe, Marigolds is on par.

I truly love this place.  The food is excellent and fresh.  A few things to keep in mind: 1) there is typically a line to order food, but moves pretty fast 2) it's a little noisy, but to be expected. 3). The dinning area is not that large and on sundays the staff keeps things flowing through the dinning area; otherwise it's seat yourself 4) if you have a child in a stroller, the stroller does not fit at all in Marigolds.  Typically, people leave strollers in the entrance way or outside.  5) Do not be frustrated when you see people finished eating and mingling at their table like no one else is waiting to sit nor do these people have the curiosity to move it along.  Car seats are okay, but seating is oriented to maximize space for tables not for a car seat necessarily. With all this in mind, try this place it's really great food.  Pricing is a little high and I wouldn't take my 6 kids, it's not oriented that way.  This place is a trendy spot with a friendly staff.

Excellent restaurant.  You order at the register and they deliver to your table.  I loved the fresh flowers throughout the restaurant!  The potatoes were excellent.  Everything perfectly prepared. Portions were just right, although surprised that a side of toast was just one slice. Great coffee!

Their wait in line, order and pay at the register, but then sit at a table system can be a little hectic during peak breakfast/brunch times.  That said, I still really enjoyed the food at this cute spot in downtown Madison.

Honestly, I just LOVE this place. I never get sick of the fresh flavors, strong coffee, and comfortable atmosphere. Whenever I go to eat with friends or family I try to stick by my rule of always going to new places, however I can't keep to that rule when it comes to Marigold!   When I came last weekend I got the roasted sweet potato, kale, and basil walnut pesto hash. I wish I could put that basil walnut pesto on top of everything I eat it was so delicious. My friends both got the chorizo breakfast burrito and though they couldn't finish it in one sitting, they were both very content with their decisions.

What a nice breakfast spot just off Capitol Sq to the SE. With bar and table seating, this spot gave off a high energy vibe.   I ordered the Chorizo omelet. It was $11 and contained chorizo sausage, roasted sweet corn relish, cilantro, and sharp cheddar cheese and like all the omelets came with potatoes and toast.   You order and pay first at the counter (menus by the register), take a number and have a seat, and a runner brings out your food to you. You get your drinks at the counter too whether you want OJ from the cooler or self-serve bottomless coffee. They also have your typical alcoholic brunch drinks.   The restaurant was about 1/3rd full and kitchen service was fast on a Thursday morning at about 8am. The staff at the register was really friendly and cheerful.

Oh wow!! Duck confit hash, need I explain more? Heirloom tomato bloody, yes please! Colectivo coffee!! Amazing service, free chai, and unlimited coffee refills! Can't wait to return and try more of the menu. All local and all delicious! Happy belly=happy guest!

My favourite brunch place in Madison, by far. I've been here twice so far and the food has not failed to impress me regardless of how busy it is. The staff are extremely nice and seem happy doing their job.   The first time we were here, it was a busy Saturday morning and the line was out the door but the turnover was fast. The food came really fast and we were in and out in no time with happy bellies. I had their salmon frittata and their scrambler with rosemary toast this time. Also a must-try is their hazelnut almond mocha and their lavender white chocolate mocha (a bit too sweet for my taste).   I love this place!

Marigold is fantastic. The food absolutely sets the standard, and the atmosphere is nice and comfortable. If I were rating on food alone, I would rate 5 stars no question. But there are some downsides: Marigold is perhaps too small, which makes for long wait times anytime you go and a /very/ cramped dining area. Additionally, its prices are high, which makes Marigold more of a special-occasion dining location than a weekly treat. The food certainly makes up for the negatives, but something to keep in mind.

I have been here twice in my life and now that I live super close, I may be here a lot more than that!  I ordered the weekend special of Chorizo Tacos with Huevos. The tacos came with chorizo (duh), shredded radish, cilantro, and cheese. It was amazing. It came with a side of black beans and of course, two eggs. I got my eggs over easy.  I also tried the Marigold Breakfast Sandwich. Anything with Boursin is the best. The ciabatta roll though was what got me. It's so fluffy, which is not a word I normally use to describe bread.  The coffee is $3 and unlimited refills, so that is honestly the best you could ask for on any morning if you need coffee.  It definitely gets busy on the weekend and especially on Farmer's Market Saturdays. We were able to find a place to sit easily. We sat outside, which was super nice.

Love everything. Egg white scrambler, amazing potatoes, rosemary toast, blueberry pancakes all delicious!! They have loose leaf tea, the pu-erh tea with ginger was amazing... Service is good, but it gets a little cramped and you're sitting back to back with someone at the peak times.  Interesting, though. You have to get in line and pay first, and then you get seated and you get your food. The line can be out the door, but it goes by quick and it's totally worth it!!

Excellence dwells within Marigold Kitchen.  Yes, this place sets itself apart from other breakfast places for sure. The food shines. Marigolds keeps up with Madison's lovely tendency towards fresh, quality ingredients; this, coupled with the way that they put these ingredients together makes for an always wondrous breakfast experience. The flavor profiles of all of their dishes are a notch or two above your traditional breakfast fare.   Oh my goodness, the potatoes. That is, the side of breakfast potatoes that come with most meals are to-die-for. Such flavorful goodness.  I so appreciated the perfectly-cooked, delicious, not greasy egg whites and the healthy size portion of bacon.  Not to mention, they had such a broad array of equally delicious breads: rye, wheat, sourdough, french rosemary. Making that decision wasn't easy, let me tell ya.  BUT you haven't heard anything yet until you hear about their pancakes. Don't even get me started on the pancakes. The orange butter/syrup that they serve alongside these cakes makes these the pancakes to beat. Absolute heaven on a plate. If this orange syrup doesn't sound like your cup of tea you should really still try it. It is so good. And that's coming from someone who's not too fond of adding fruity things to other aspects of a meal. Normally, I like my fruit and I like my pancakes, separate that is. But no, you simply must try this pairing.  Overall, the food is great and the location is ideal.  Quaint spot that I highly recommend to all.

Our first time to The Marigold. Wow! Although the line was huge (Sunday brunch) it was well worth the wait both for service and food.   My partner and I shared the Roasted butternut frittata and the sour cream pancakes.  Both scrumptious. The frittata came with a small field greens salad that perfectly accompanied the savory squash with yummy button mushrooms; and just the perfect amount of havarti.   The pancakes were delicately stuffed with cinnamon apples. On an October morning, nothing better.   Inspite of the crowd, the staff was warm and very patient. They found seating for us in an extremely crowed Sunday morning. Cant wait to be back!

I love brunches and marigold does them better than anyone in the isthmus area. They get a heavy volume of people over the weekends, and yet they maintain their quality in pretty much everything they do.  They have a lot of good seasonal omelettes, waffles, amazing espresso drinks and pastries. Their stuff isn't too greasy that's blatantly catering to your taste buds, instead the allure is more subtle and comes from varied flavors.  The decor is modern trendy hipster if you're into that sort of thing. The staff are friendly and polite despite dealing with heavy volumes constantly.  I'd highly recommend marigold for your brunch needs if you're in the isthmus area.

I have always been a huge fan of Marigold's. I used to eat there every Saturday and always recommended it to all my friends as the best brunch in Madison. Having been a long time fan of Marigolds, I'm very disappointed with my recent experiences there.  I've been unimpressed with them lately to the point where I feel compelled to update my review.  The egg dishes have been very greasy. I couldn't even finish eating my scrambler because It was so unappetizing.  On my visit last Saturday, the water cups by the self-serve water jug and coffee were stacked soaking wet...I'm certified in food safety and sanitation and know that dishes must air dry completely before being stacked to prevent bacterial growth. After seeing this, I was hesitant, but filled up 2 water glasses for my husband and I. My husbands glass had a huge lipstick stain---GROSS.   I really hope Marigolds turns it around.
Great location, just off Capitol Square. Food is fresh and interesting and it's a lively scene. I go there whenever I'm in Madison. Breakfast, lunch and brunch are all great.
Great food. Can get very crowded. One of the best breakfast places in Madison, but skip if you do not want to wait in line.

Went there last weekend on a busy Sunday morning. They have a different setup, where you wait in line, order, pay and then are assigned a seat. But they run it so well you really are only waiting for a short time after ordering.   The food is really delicious. I had a great omelette as top-notch cafe au lait.  If in Madison, this is a great breakfast spot.

I have come here twice while visiting Madison and I must say my girlfriend and I love it. The line can seem intimidating at times but tables flip fast and the line out the door can turn out to be only 15 minutes worth of a wait. The scrambler is excellent, any pancake or French toast dish is to die for and the omelets are always delicious. Do yourself a favor and get your butt down to marigold kitchen for breakfast brunch or even lunch. You will not be disappointed.

Located just off of the square, this tiny nook of a restaurant is almost always busy.  The crowds are justified; I've never had an "off" meal here. They serve excellent brunch with all of the standbys but somewhat more thoughtfully prepared. They also have great sandwiches and salads for lunch. I love their cole slaw with fennel seeds. The only downside is the wait you will most likely encounter.

Probably my favorite brunch spot in Madison. You can always expect to wait at least 15 minutes at Marigold, because they serve food in style similar to Panera (wait in line to order & pay, wait at table for food), and the line always reaches to the door. It's worth the wait.  I usually opt for the breakfast sandwich option, which is different depending on when you go, since Marigold has a rotating menu. The sandwiches are always amazing, though the accompanying potatoes are just okay. It's usually enough food for me to take something home. I've also tried the scramblers a few times and have never been disappointed.  They have delicious iced teas and other gourmet drinks to sip on while you wait for a table. Tables are available on a first come, first serve basis, so it's probably not a great spot if you're with a large group, since you could end up waiting quite a while.

Love this spot in Madison! I visited on business and checked Yelp reviews for breakfast and I chose right... This is an adorable spot on the street (maybe you'd pass right by?) - many breakfast options... order at the counter and keep a number and they deliver to your table.  It was delicious. I'm not from the area so I can't speak on prices to quantity ratio, but the food was good and the staff was friendly!
